Stress Monitor gives you a real-time stress score between 0 and 3 by measuring your heart rate and HRVÂ and comparing that to your baseline. You can then choose a science-backed breathwork session to help you better manage those stressful moments.

Oh, and you wonâ€™t need to be hooked up to a bunch of wires for it to work. The slim, stylish WHOOP wearable <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6f7507c4> slips onto your wrist and immediately begins measuring your heart rate variability, sleep, recovery, daily activity, and now stress levels.

Commit to your best, less-stressed self <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80eVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3JmxwPXRleHQz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3872540a>.

The regulator is primarily concerned that ChatGPT collects and stores Italian usersâ€™ personal data without their permission. It also called out the chatbotâ€™s lack of age verification.

AI chatbots *do* have a lot of data in their trunk

The ban stems from a recent accidental leak of user conversations with ChatGPT. But things could get even thornier if the regulator decides to also delve into the other kind of data the system stores. AI systems like ChatGPT make huge sweeps of the internet and feed all that info into their underlying algorithms. Sorting out what data out of that info glut belongs to Italian citizens if necessary would beâ€¦complicated.

INSIDE JOBS

The only career where your hand might be more precious than a hand modelâ€™s Jim from the Office doing jazz hands The Office/NBC via Giphy
â€‹â€‹Inside Jobs, our series on unconventional careers, is back.

Michelle Marquis is a professional calligrapher. Thatâ€™s right, she not only still remembers how to write in cursive, but she gets paid to do it with styleâ€”full time. Marquis majored in science, but shortly after graduating took a calligraphy class and started writing as a hobby. It didnâ€™t take long for people to ask her to take on projects, and she turned it into her career.

Now, her most popular service is engraving wine bottles <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31029240.2950477/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Qm8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAyOTI0MC4yOTUwNDc3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8499a5e> for special occasions, but she also creates wedding invitations and even performs calligraphy in person for customers at luxury boutiques like Guerlain. We asked her all about her loopy career.

LEGAL

It happened: Trump indicted on criminal charges <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D15459a1e> Former President Trump <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E15459a1e> Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images
Well, weâ€™re back to living in unprecedented times. In a first for a former US president, Donald Trump was indicted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4dc964d0> on criminal charges by a New York grand jury yesterday, his lawyers and prosecutors said.

To call this explosive doesnâ€™t do justice to TNTâ€”it will become the defining plotline of the 2024 presidential race, which Trump has already entered in his bid to reclaim the White House.

So, what are the charges?

No one actually knows yet. Charges are sometimes kept under wraps until the defendant makes their first appearance in court (known as an arraignment). Trump is expected to be arraigned in New York City next Tuesday, according to CNN.

But we do know what the investigation centered on: $130,000 in hush money sent to porn star Stormy Daniels by Trumpâ€™s former lawyer, Michael Cohen. Daniels claims to have had an affair with Trumpâ€”which he denies, along with the allegations that he was involved in paying her to keep quiet. Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, a Democrat, is accusing Trump and his company of falsifying business records to hide this payment.

An indictment is just the beginning of the process for the government to make a criminal caseâ€”and an eventual conviction is no slam dunk <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02208d39>. It relies on a â€œnovel legal theoryâ€ that â€œhas never been tested in court,â€ according to the National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers.

To prove Trump committed a felony, prosecutors will have to demonstrate that he falsified these records to cover up or commit a seperate crime.

Everyone chimed in

Following the indictment, both political parties staked out their positions.

Democrats said the charges show that the US justice system works as designed to hold the powerful to account and that no one, not even a former president, is above the law.

Republicans, echoing Trumpâ€™s rebuttal, claimed it was a political hit job by Dems to weaken his 2024 prospects against President Biden. Trump will likely lean into this â€œwitch huntâ€ theme on the campaign trail, he's already called the indictment â€œPolitical Persecution and Election Interference at the highest level in history.â€

What happens next: When Trump arrives in New York next week for his arraignment, heâ€™ll be fingerprinted and have a mug shot taken (which will easily become the most viral picture of all time if made public).

This could also be the first of several indictments to come through the pipeline for Trump. Heâ€™s being investigated in three other criminal probes, including one over his alleged mishandling of classified documents.â€”NF

Russia arrests American journalist for alleged espionage. A reporter for the Wall Street Journal, Evan Gershkovich, was arrested Wednesday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf974e367> in the city of Yekaterinburg for allegedly investigating Russian military secrets for the US. Itâ€™s the first time an American journalist has been detained on espionage charges in Russia since the Cold War and a sign of escalating tensions between the rival countries as Russiaâ€™s war in Ukraine continues. The WSJ said it â€œvehemently denies the allegations,â€ and the White House also condemned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80di0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cea83d738> Russiaâ€™s â€œtargeting of American citizens.â€

A court nixed an Obamacare preventative care mandate. Yesterday, a federal judge in Texas blocked <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84f12602> the Affordable Care Actâ€™s mandate that required insurers to cover PrEP, an HIV preventative medication, and preventative screenings for some cancers. The ruling could affect nearly 100 million Americans who use one or more of these ACA-covered services. The ruling came in a lawsuit that argued the mandate forces religious employers to cover drugs that â€œencourage homosexual behavior, prostitution, sexual promiscuity, and intravenous drug use.â€ The Biden administration is expected to appeal, and insurers are still likely to offer this coverage for now. Wall Street bonuses slashed. If your I-banking friend is summering in Havasu instead of the Hamptons this year, it may be because the average Wall Street bonus plunged by 26% <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbd6bb25d> in 2022 to $176,700. This drop, which is the biggest since 2008, is a consequence of both a slowdown in dealmaking and cost-cutting efforts by banks. There were only 71 Wall Street-led IPOs last year that raised a total of $7.7 billionâ€”a tiny fraction of the $142 billion raised by IPOs in 2021. Wall Street bonuses typically account for more than 75% of total comp for NYC-based bankers and traders, per the Financial Times.

Just hours after the world learned that Trump had been indicted, another headline-grabbing legal battle reached its conclusion: A jury found Gwyneth Paltrow not at fault <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80d2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd793cc8c> for a 2016 ski collision in Utah that injured retired optometrist Terry Sanderson, who sued her for $300,000.

Paltrow not only won the $1 she requested in her countersuit against Sanderson, but she also won the internet. The eight-day trial inspired an avalanche of TikToks and memes that framed Paltrow, an actor and business mogul, as a heroic figure in this drama.

Why was the trial so viral? Mainly because it produced so many soundbites that seemed like they were lifted from a White Lotus episode skewering the wealthy and aloof.

After being asked how the crash inconvenienced her, Paltrow told the courtroom, â€œWell, I lost half a day of skiing.â€

Paltrow was questioned about â€œintimateâ€ gifts she had given to Taylor Swift.

Sandersonâ€™s witnesses said that following the crash, he was unable to enjoy wine tastings.

Big picture: Having built her Goop empire on outrageously expensive candles and scientifically murky wellness advice, Paltrow has been preparing for the role of out-of-touch rich woman in court for a long time.â€”MM

BUSINESS

It looks like Disney has added a new character to the Magic Kingdom: the troll.

The company quietly entered agreements <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31016365.2945901/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80dlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAxNjM2NS4yOTQ1OTAx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdc62044b> that rendered the board Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis hand-picked to govern the special tax district surrounding Disney World nearly powerless.

Bewildered board members only learned about these agreements this week, and one said they planned to â€œcorrectâ€ Disneyâ€™s behind-the-scenes sleight of hand. Disney, though, asserts it was all kosher.

How did we get here? For 55 years, the state allowed Disney to make its own rules for developing the land where its theme parks sit. But after the company criticized the so-called â€œDonâ€™t Say Gayâ€ bill, DeSantis installed his own board to run the district.

With the new board in place, it looked like DeSantis had wonâ€¦until Disney pulled a Mulan-like switcheroo. When the board was still Disney-controlled, it entered into restrictive covenants for the land that:

Bar the new board from using the Disney name or any of the companyâ€™s IP, including Mickey Mouse.

Give Disney the right to review any proposed changes to properties in the district.

And, fittingly for a company synonymous with princesses, Disney made the agreements valid until â€œ21 years after the death of the last survivor of the descendants of King Charles III, king of England.â€â€”AR

Elon Musk and other tech leaders signed an open letter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfad60a4a> calling on developers to â€œpause giant AI experiments.â€ The petition, which more than 1,000 folks have signed, warns that artificial intelligence poses â€œprofound risks to society and humanityâ€ and asks AI researchers to put their projects on ice for at least six months.

Thatâ€™s asking a lot: OpenAI launched the latest version of its artificially intelligent chatbot, ChatGPT 4, this month; Google started rolling out its AI chatbot called Bard last week; and Microsoft added AI capabilities to its Bing search engine in February. Goldman Sachs even shared a report <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca5b13033> on Monday that said AI could boost worker productivity so much that annual world GDP would jump by 7%.

So, why stop the progress now?

For Frankensteinian reasons: Per the letter, developers are â€œlocked in an out-of-control race to develop and deploy ever more powerful digital minds that no oneâ€”not even their creatorsâ€”can understand, predict, or reliably control.â€

The letter calls out AI systemsâ€™ tendency toward confidently pumping out misinformation and escalates quickly to discuss AIâ€™s potential to automate jobs and â€œoutsmartâ€ and â€œreplace usâ€ to the point that we â€œrisk loss of control of our civilization.â€ *Sips coffee.*

It was penned by the Future of Life Institute, a nonprofit organization focused on mitigating existential threats <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb71c1d29> to humanity, particularly AI. Notable signatories besides Musk include Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak, Skype co-founder Jaan Tallinn, and politician Andrew Yang.

To ensure AI ends up being more Wall-E than Skynet, the letter asks AI labs to use what it calls an â€œAI summerâ€ break to create and implement safety protocols that ramp up oversight on the development of artificially intelligent systems. If not, it asks governments to step in and force the pause.

Yeah, butâ€¦other experts, including Bingâ€™s AI chatbot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef694eb0> (!), say that even if the tech has issues, a pause isnâ€™t the right solution. Critics say the letter contributes to â€œAI hypeâ€ and overfocuses on the threat to knowledge workers above other concerns.â€”JW

The FDA approved over-the-counter sales of an opioid overdose drug. The agency decided that Narcan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5e035ce9> can be sold without a prescription, paving the way for the lifesaving nasal spray that reverses opioid overdoses to become more widely available. The move follows the deaths of more than 100,000 Americans due to drug overdoses last year. The company that makes Narcan, which has been available with a prescription since 2015, said it expects to be selling it in stores and online by late summer.

Adidas decides not to object to a BLM stripe design after all. Adidas withdrew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce50f85c0> its objection to a Black Lives Matter groupâ€™s application for a US trademark featuring three parallel stripesâ€”48 hours after filing it. The company didnâ€™t explain its decision to yank its complaint, which stated that the design was too similar to its logo, but Reuters reported it was because the concern could be misconstrued as opposition to BLMâ€™s goals. The sportswear brand is likely looking to avoid that kind of attention after parting ways with Kanye West over his racist and antisemitic statements.

Marvel chief out at Disney. Disney fired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7aa1cac7> Ike Perlmutter, who sold Marvel to Disney for ~$4 billion in 2009. Disney described the termination as part of its recent decision to lay off 7,000 employees (it also cut the entire Marvel Entertainment unit he ran, which is distinct from the Marvel Studios unit that makes all those blockbusters). But Perlmutter wasnâ€™t just any Disney employee, and heâ€™d recently butted heads with CEO Bob Iger by backing activist investor Nelson Peltzâ€™s bid to get a seat on the companyâ€™s board.

But itâ€™s no secret that Starbucks has fought unionization efforts. Since fall 2021, 290 Starbucks stores have voted to unionize. In that time, Starbucks Workers United has filed 500+ charges of unfair labor practices against the company, and judges have ruled that Starbucks broke federal labor law 130 times.

Bernieâ€™s not the only outsider getting involved:

Itâ€™s Opening Day for Major League Baseball, and the main storylines weâ€™re watching are a) all the rule changes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C06a96012> intended to speed up the game and b) the stunning transformation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/31001235.2956058/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80cjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMTAwMTIzNS4yOTU2MDU4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5851188d> of the NY Mets from a hapless franchise laced with self-pity to the biggest spender the league has ever seen.

That makeover is the work of Steve Cohen, a hedge fund billionaire who bought the Mets for $2.4 billion in 2020. This offseason, Cohen maxed out his AmEx Black Card on free agents to bring the teamâ€™s projected 2023 payroll to ~$370 million, shattering the MLB record.

For comparison, the team with the second-biggest payroll is the Yankees, who are spending about $210 million on players this year.

We should mention the Mets are also expected to owe a record luxury tax of ~$100 million.

Whatâ€™s Cohenâ€™s deal? If youâ€™ve seen the show Billions, the investor Bobby Axelrod is loosely based on him. In 2013, Cohenâ€™s hedge fund, SAC Capital, pleaded guilty to insider trading, resulting in Cohen paying $1.8 billion in fines and getting temporarily banned from managing money for clients.

Zoom out: MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred said this week that Cohenâ€™s unheard-of spending spree has â€œreal benefits for the game,â€ but also widens the gap between the small- and large-market teams. Good morning. According to the New York Times, there is apparently a monthly Ryan Meetup for Ryans at Ryan Maguireâ€™s Bar & Restaurant in Manhattanâ€”no non-Ryans allowed.

This Ryan congress builds on a rich tradition of people gathering for no apparent reason other than they share the first name on their birth certificate.

In the past two years, Joshes have convened in Nebraska for the annual â€œJosh Fightâ€ to raise money for charity.

But our favorite same-name meetup happened at a UK pub in 2019, where 433 Nigels got together to â€œcelebrate Nigelnessâ€ before the name goes extinct. No one in the country named their baby Nigel in 2020.

â€”Matty Merritt, Sam Klebanov, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein

FINANCE

Apple is getting into buy now, pay later <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dde74974a> Apple pay later screen. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ede74974a> Apple
It has never been easier to trick yourself into paying $250 for a pair of jeans, because Apple rolled out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C821cff80> its buy now, pay later (BNPL) service yesterday. The feature, Apple Pay Later, was introduced to randomly selected Apple Pay users and will become available to more customers over the next few months.

How it works: When using Apple Pay to buy something, users can pay for $50â€“$1,000 purchases in four payments over six weeks with no interest or fees.

Itâ€™s a weird time to get into BNPL

Rewind to peak Covid, when digital layaway companies were hotter than matching sweatsuits. In 2021, Swedish BNPL company Klarna was Europeâ€™s most valuable fintech startup at a valuation of $45.6 billion. The same year, Block (formerly Square) bought the Australian BNPL company Afterpay for a staggering $30 billion.

But eye-popping valuations didnâ€™t stick around for long. By mid-2022, rising interest rates strained BNPL companiesâ€™ business models, and regulators started cracking down on potentially predatory lending practices. Plus, the BNPL field has gotten more crowded than an Old Navy during the 2010 $1 flip-flop sale as established companies like Walmart and PayPal tried to cash in on the gold rush.

But now, the state of BNPL looks more likeâ€¦an Old Navy the day after the $1 flip-flop sale. Klarnaâ€™s valuation plummeted 85% to just $6.7 billion in a July 2022 funding round. And when the short seller Hindenburg accused <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4de07c9f> Block of being ultra-sketchy in a scathing report last week, it said that acquiring Afterpay was actually a very bad idea, btw, because the company was â€œdesigned in a way that avoided responsible lending rules.â€

Apple sees opportunity among the ruins

While unprofitable BNPL startups watch their VC drips dry up, the tech behemoth is cool with losing money on its Apple Pay Later feature for a while. Itâ€™s got iPhone money. And Apple has been playing the long game in its ultimate goal of replacing your leather wallet completely. In October 2014, when Apple Pay was first introduced, 3% of retailers in the US used its contactless payment service. Now, over 85% of retailers accept Apple Pay.â€”MM

Between 1966 and 2019, 77% of mass shooters bought at least one of the guns they used in their attacks legally, according to the National Institute of Justice. Syed, whose efforts to overturn his conviction gained national prominence via the massively popular podcast Serial, spent 23 years in prison while maintaining his innocence. The courtâ€™s decision will not necessarily send Syed back there, as it gives the parties 60 days to decide how to move forward.

Sam Bankman-Fried charged with bribing Chinese officials. US prosecutors added another indictment <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc6028123> to SBFâ€™s already extensive list of criminal counts, accusing the FTX founder of bribing Chinese government officials with ~$40 million worth of crypto payments. AI

ChatGPT is coming for workers who type a lot <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D47f3d51d> South Park gif about automation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80blo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E47f3d51d> Southpark via Giphy
Accountants, survey researchers, and interpreters could see a sizable chunk of their day-to-day work get outsourced to ChatGPT, according to a study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C09f4056d> published by researchers from the University of Pennsylvania and OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT.

If youâ€™re not eager to compete with a language model for a job, you might want to consider physical labor. The study found that for tire repairers, meatpackers, and athletes, ChatGPT was about as impactful as a degree in metaverse real estate management.

Ultimately, the study found the most GPT-able jobs to be those performed by knowledge workers, particularly ones who spend their days coding and writing .

The paper stopped short of predicting how quickly typing prompts into AI tools could become part of the workflow of various jobs. But itâ€™s already happening at some workplaces: One digital artist went viral recently by lamenting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C44da36ea> how their job went from creating original art to entering prompts into the text-to-image AI app Midjourney and editing its output in a matter of weeks.

Looking aheadâ€¦almost 1 in 5 US employees could have at least half of their work tasks disrupted by ChatGPT, per the study. And Goldman Sachs estimates that AI chatbots might affect 300 million full-time workers across the major economies.â€”SK

FOOD

Cloudy with a chance of mammoth meatballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D79dd9dff> Mammoth meatballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E79dd9dff> Vow
The Australian food company Vow said yesterday that itâ€™s made a meatball <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C387ee1af> from the extinct woolly mammoth.

This wasnâ€™t the result of a freezer cleanup 10,000 years overdue. Vow â€œgrowsâ€ unconventional meat in a lab to offer a protein alternative to slaughtered animals and reduce the environmental impact of animal agriculture.

To make the mammoth meatball, Vow took the DNA sequence of a mammothâ€™s muscle protein, added a splash of elephant DNA, and then inserted that completed gene into a sheep muscle cell, where it was grown (along with many more sheep genes) into 400 grams of meat. Add salt to taste.

So, why mammoth? The animal probably wasnâ€™t chosen because itâ€™s particularly tender or goes well with marinaraâ€”unfortunately, Neanderthal Guy Fieri didnâ€™t leave a review.

Instead, the mammoth was selected to generate marketing buzz around Vowâ€™s mission. The idea was the brainchild of creative agency Wunderman Thompson, whose global chief creative officer,â€‹â€‹ Bas Korsten, told the Guardian that mammoth meatballs were intended to â€œstart a conversationâ€ about the harmful environmental impact of meat consumption.

Looking aheadâ€¦the mammoth meatball wonâ€™t be coming to an Ikea near you anytime soon. But Vow is hoping to get its first cultivated meat product, Japanese quail, sold in restaurants in Singapore this year.â€”NF

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Marshall Islands soccer ball Francis Scialabba
Stat: The Marshall Islands is the only UN-recognized country without a national soccer team <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48aa02c9>, according to ESPN. Yes, even Vatican City (which is one-seventh the size of Central Park) has a national soccer team. But some Marshall Islands soccer boosters are aiming to establish a team and one day upset Brazil at the World Cup. Okay, maybe their ambitions donâ€™t extend that far, but they do want to use soccer to raise awareness about climate changeâ€™s impacts on this cluster of islands in the Pacific Ocean. Projections show that 40% of the capital island of Majuro will be underwater by 2030.

Quote: â€œSVBâ€™s failure is a textbook case of mismanagement.â€

Michael Barr, the Fedâ€™s vice chair for supervision, and other financial regulators testified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bzM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd4aecd82> on Capitol Hill yesterday about the two biggest bank blowups since the financial crisis. Lawmakers were keen to blame both Silicon Valley Bankâ€™s executives, who made risky bets that collapsed in value, and regulators, who may have been asleep at the wheel. No consensus was reached on how to prevent the next bank from imploding.

Read: The impossible job of being a Premier League referee. (The Guardian <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30990196.3341713/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80bnU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk5MDE5Ni4zMzQxNzEz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca343488d>)

ANSWER

Shooting at Nashville elementary school leaves six dead. Three children and three adults were killed yesterday in a shooting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2e294c8c> at The Covenant School, a private Presbyterian elementary school in Nashville, Tennessee.The six victims have been identified as Evelyn Dieckhaus, Hallie Scruggs, and William Kinney, who were nine years old, and Cynthia Peak, Mike Hill, and Katherine Koonce, adults in their early sixties. Koonce is believed to have been the head of the school.

The shooter was also killed while exchanging fire with police. The suspected attacker was identified by police as a 28 year-old former student of the school. According to police <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80anM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce1d9769e>, the shooter, who entered the school with at least two assault-style rifles and a handgun, had written a manifesto and drawn detailed maps of the school before the attacks. In the aftermath of the attack, there was confusion regarding the assailantâ€™s gender because police originally said the alleged shooter was a woman before saying the shooter was transgender and used male pronouns in recent LinkedIn postings.

Israel postpones controversial judicial overhaul. Israelâ€™s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said yesterday that â€œto avoid civil war,â€ he would delay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aV8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C963ba1bf> his plan to revamp the countryâ€™s judiciary to bring it more under the ruling partyâ€™s power until after it could be debated during the next parliamentary session in April. The decision came after strikes and mass protests brought the country to a standstill. After the announcement, the leader of Israelâ€™s largest trade union said it would call off the general strike by its 800,000 members.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

Stylinâ€™ Pope Francis is regrettably fake <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6773ab19> The pope in a stylish coat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6773ab19>
â€œPope Francis? More like Pope fashionista â€ was everyoneâ€™s reaction this weekend to a viral photo of the pontiff sporting a stylish puffer jacket looking like he marched straight out of Milan fashion week. However, to the disappointment of the Very Online of all creeds, the image turned out to be an AI-generated deepfake.

But before its authenticity was debunked, millions of people (including half of our editorial team) took the realistic-looking image at face value and subsequently felt mildly embarrassed at being so easily duped.

Where it came from: â€œBalenciaga Popeâ€ was brought to us by Midjourney, an artificial intelligence app that generates images from text prompts. It was created and posted to Reddit by a user who was apparently just trying to have a laugh while tripping on magic mushrooms <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C550a2355>, per BuzzFeed.

What gives it away: Upon closer inspection, the picture does offer some clues that it isnâ€™t actually a candid shot snapped by a paparazzi on the streets of Vatican City. Some tell-tale signs:

The Popeâ€™s glasses look like they're melting onto his face.

The crucifix appears somewhat deformed.

Why people are still unnerved

Midjourneyâ€™s ability to have us marveling at the Popeâ€™s chic â€™fit got people thinking about what rapid advances in hyperrealistic AI art mean for our post-truth world. Web culture journalist Ryan Broderick dubbed the papal hoax the first â€œmass-level AI misinformation case.â€

Another recent, viral, AI-made image showed it could be used to spread false narratives for more politically polarizing topics than the pope's fashion choices. Investigative journalist Eliot Higgins used Midjourney to churn out a series of images depicting former President Donald Trump getting arrested after an on-foot police chase, amid talk of his impending indictment (Higgins later got banned from Midjourney for doing so).

Looking aheadâ€¦ AI expert Henry Ajder told Business Insider heâ€™s urging AI companies to embed safeguardsâ€”like watermarks for manipulated images and disclaimers for videosâ€”into the technology to prevent it from being weaponized for fake news.â€”SK

Next up on regulatorsâ€™ crypto takedown: Binance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D58b28421> Binance CEO <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E58b28421> Antonio Masiello/Getty Images
Yesterday, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) sued Binance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78bfa870>, the worldâ€™s largest crypto exchange, along with its co-founder Changpeng Zhao and its former Chief Compliance Officer Samuel Limâ€”for allegedly evading US regulations.

The CFTC alleges that Binanceâ€¦

Didnâ€™t have an effective program in place to prevent money laundering.

Encouraged customers to access Binance via virtual private networks (VPNs), allowing them to make unpermitted trades from the US.

Built a base of high-net-worth â€œVIPâ€ customers and gave them a heads-up when law enforcement looked into their assets.

The agency claims Binanceâ€™s money laundering reporting officer once told Lim, â€œWe see the bad, but we close 2 eyes.â€

Big picture: US regulators are bringing down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ajc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17d315a5> the hammer on crypto companiesâ€¦even though theyâ€™re already thoroughly smooshed following the collapse of crypto exchange FTX and, more recently, of crypto banks Silvergate Capital and Signature Bank.

REAL ESTATE

East coast, beast coast (for housing prices) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Db1360373> Illustration of a map of the US with homes dotted on it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eb1360373> Morning Brew
The East Coastâ€“West Coast rivalry is typically associated with rappers or sports teams, but now the divisions are extending toâ€¦the housing market.

Just like the sun, home prices are dropping in the West while rising in the East, according to the Wall Street Journal <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2653694d>. This stark geographical split is extremely unusual, and highlights Covidâ€™s role in shuffling people around the country in weird ways. The key stats:

West of Texas (but including Austin), home prices in the 12 major housing markets fell in January on an annual basis, data from Black Knight showed.

But home prices increased in the 37 largest metros east of Colorado (excluding Austin).

Whatâ€™s going on? Western â€œZoom Townsâ€ that welcomed an influx of residents during the pandemic (think Boise) saw their bubbly home prices start to pop as mortgage rates spiked. Plus, the tech hubs that were so dang unaffordable even before Covid (SF, San Jose) have taken a hit from the recent downturn in the sector.

Meanwhile, on the East Coast, consistent job growth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80anI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4becbc8f>, tight housing inventory, and the fact that many cities there didnâ€™t see a ludicrous price boom during Covid are helping push prices higher.

Big picture: Nationally, the median home price dropped annually <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30975626.3339790/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80aVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk3NTYyNi4zMzM5Nzkw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9485996> in February for the first time in more than a decade, and experts predict more year over year declines in many markets.â€”NF

Markets: Investors are entering the last week of March as directionless as Ben Braddock in The Graduate. With the banking sector skittish, the Fed winding down its interest rate hikes, and inflation still soaringâ€¦the outlook for the economy has rarely been this cloudy. Still, all three major indexes posted gains last week.

INTERNATIONAL

Israel crisis grows after Bibi fires defense minister <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcdd63098> An aerial view of the streets as Israelis continue protests against the Israeli government's plan to introduce judicial changes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecdd63098> Gitai Palti/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin â€œBibiâ€ Netanyahu sacked his defense minister yesterday, sparking large-scale protests and escalating a crisis <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccabac66f> thatâ€™s now freezing much of its economy.

The countryâ€™s largest trade union group, which represents almost 800,000 workers across a range of industries, announced a strike, halting departures at Ben Gurion Airport and leaving some hospitals with reduced staff. The countryâ€™s research universities are also suspending classes indefinitely beginning today.

How we got here

Israelis have been staging mass protests for months against the hard-right coalition governmentâ€™s plan to overhaul a judiciary that it claims has become too interventionist. Critics say this proposal, which gives the coalition government the final word over judicial appointments, would weaken Israelâ€™s checks and balances and erode its democracy.

And there are a lot of criticsâ€”including military reservists in elite units who said they wouldnâ€™t show up for duty. That prompted so much alarm in military circles that on Saturday, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, a senior member of Netanyahuâ€™s political party, publicly called <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C13859afa> on the government to delay its overhaul.

The plan presents â€œa clear and immediate and tangible danger to the security of the stateâ€”I shall not be a party to this,â€ Gallant said. Netanyahu fired him the next day.

Political crisis is not good for business

You typically donâ€™t see corporate elites hitting the streets to demonstrate, but thatâ€™s been happening in Israel as the business community warns that the judiciary reforms would severely damage the countryâ€™s economy <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32ec54f4>â€”specifically its vaunted high-tech sector.

Israel has prided itself as the â€œstartup nationâ€ thanks to its world-famous tech ecosystem that churns out unicorns. But many business leadersâ€”from major bank CEOs to startup foundersâ€”argue that the governmentâ€™s judiciary plans would weaken Israelâ€™s legal institutions, potentially lead to a credit rating downgrade, and dry up the foreign investment upon which these startups depend. An estimated 90% of the high-tech sector is funded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30964456.3343855/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80ZWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk2NDQ1Ni4zMzQzODU1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce752f828> by investors outside of Israel, per The Guardian.

The plan has even attracted critics in the US. Good morning. Wanna retire young? Be more like Ash Ketchum. The beloved PokÃ©mon trainer is retiring from the Japanese anime series today at the sprightly age of 10â€”the same age that he was in the pilot episode 25 years ago.

Ash is one of the best-known examples of the â€œNot Allowed to Grow Up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OWs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc710ece5>â€ TV trope, which originated in early sitcoms to preserve the comedic dynamics of the nuclear family. Of course, itâ€™s a little easier to pull off with an animated character.

Jamieâ€™s thought experiment: Which characters across TV have stayed the same age the longest? (Besides the Simpsons family.)

At a spicy hearing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C353f988c> on Capitol Hill yesterday, TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew fought for the appâ€™s survival in the US.

With calls to ban TikTok gaining momentum, the company dispatched its head honchoâ€”a Harvard Business School gradâ€”to alleviate concerns that the Chinese-owned social media app could be used as a spying tool far more potent than any balloon.

He didnâ€™t make much progress

The first lawmaker to speak, House Energy and Commerce Committee Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers, fired up the grill by calling for a ban on TikTok: â€œByteDance is beholden to the CCP, and ByteDance and TikTok are one and the same,â€ she said, referring to the Chinese Communist Partyâ€™s ability to force ByteDance (TikTokâ€™s parent company) to give it information.

In his testimony, Chew didnâ€™t exactly instill confidence that TikTok had a firewall against China. For instance, he couldnâ€™t unequivocally deny that Chinese ByteDance employees can access US user data. â€œI think quite frankly your testimony has raised more questions for me than answers,â€ Democratic Rep. Lisa Blunt Rochester said.

But lawmakers didnâ€™t just focus on TikTokâ€™s ties to China. They attacked the app over problems like misinformation, addiction, and dangerous viral trendsâ€”issues that Chew pointed out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OE8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce0f80525> plague US social media companies as well.

TikTok has launched a full-court press to defend itself

Not only in the halls of Congress, but also in the court of public opinion.

This week, TikTok sent an army of influencers to Washington, DC, to make the case that the app was a net positive for society and allowed them and other creators to make a living.

Chew also noted that TikTok now has 150 million monthly users in the US, equivalent to 45% of the population. His not-so-subtle message: Do you really think you can take away something nearly half of Americans love and still expect to be reelected?

Still, analysts watching the hearing gave Chewâ€™s performance two thumbs down. Wedbushâ€™s Dan Ives called it a â€œdisaster <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48d1fce5>â€ that only accelerates a TikTok ban or a sale.

Where things stand: The Biden administration has demanded that ByteDance sell its stake in TikTok or get booted from the US. China has responded that it will â€œfirmly opposeâ€ a forced sale.â€”NF

Hindenburg Research sank its teeth into its next victim: Block, a fintech giant led by former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey. The short seller, known for digging up corporate dirt, released a report yesterday alleging that Block is letting fraud flourish <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2a6d88bd> on its mobile payment service Cash App to pad its growth data.

Blockâ€™s stock crumpled nearly 15% after Hindenburg released its two-year investigation. The biggest allegations:

According to Hindenburg, former Cash App employees estimate that 40%â€“75% of accounts on the app were either fake or fraudulent and could be traced back to one person.

It also claimed Cash App played host to numerous scams conducted by users involving Covid stimulus and unemployment payments.

Hindenburg pointed to rappers bragging about paying for drugsâ€”and in one case, potentially murderâ€”via Cash App in their songs.

Block called the report â€œinaccurate and misleadingâ€ and threatened potential legal action.

Big picture: You might remember Hindenburg for exposing sketchy behavior at EV startup Nikola, which ultimately led to former CEO Trevor Milton getting convicted of fraud. But its most damning accusation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce9d7da54> was lobbed at Indian conglomerate Adani Group in January for â€œpulling the largest con in corporate history.â€ Adani denied the claims, but the report still caused a $100+ billion wipeout in market value.â€”MM

This week the Writers Guild of America, a labor union that reps film and TV writers, proposed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce82bf4e0>Â that AI be allowed to help write scripts.

The idea arose during routine negotiations between the WGA and the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers, which reps studios, over writersâ€™ pay <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C78902636>. And while letting ChatGPT in the writers room sounds like a job threat, the details of the WGAâ€™s proposal could ensure we wonâ€™t see a robot giving an Oscars speech anytime soon.

AI could do some of the work but get none of the credit

The union tweeted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd2996610> that it considers AI to be merely â€œresearch material,â€ noting that â€œAI software does not create anything. It generates a regurgitation of what itâ€™s fed.â€

Therefore, the WGA proposes that AI could be used to help write scripts. But the writer who turns AI-generated text into a show or movie would get all the creditâ€”and compensation.

Zoom out: Creative industries everywhere are discussing what guardrails should be established around using AI to produce content. While the WGAâ€™s proposal could set a precedent for materials created with AI, some are wonderingâ€¦what happens when AI gets good enough to write a screenplay without a human co-writer?â€”JW

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Jennifer Coolidge in White Lotus The White Lotus/HBO
Stat: If you film it, they will come. In a survey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc896d085> from American Express, 70% of Gen Z and millennials said they were inspired to travel to a destination after seeing it in a TV show, movie, or news source. HBO incepting your next vacation is best showcased by The White Lotus, the hit series set in posh hotels in Maui and Sicily. The Four Seasons Mauiâ€™s website saw a 425% annual increase in traffic during season one, and good luck finding a place to stay in Taormina this summer.

Quote: â€œThe current development, where billionaire sheiks and oligarchs take over clubs and control them as their personal playgrounds, is not a healthy trend.â€

To reverse this trend in soccer, Finnish entrepreneur Thomas Zilliacus said he wants to go halfsies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30940958.2951114/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80OTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDk0MDk1OC4yOTUxMTE0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C107ee487> with fans on a bid to purchase Manchester Unitedâ€”his company would buy 50% of the club, while MUFC fans would grab the rest. Zilliacus calculated that if all fans participated, the cost would amount to less than $3 per supporter. The only other known bidders for Manchester United are British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe and Qatarâ€™s Sheikh Jassim.

ECONOMY

Fed keeps hiking, but summit seems close <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D1b36b486> Jerome Powell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E1b36b486>
Like Ted Lasso and Succession, the Federal Reserveâ€™s interest rate hikes have apparently entered their final season.

While the Fed increased interest rates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C19f85970> by another 25 basis points yesterday (its ninth straight rate increase), it also signaled that troubles in the banking sector could lead it to wrap up the rate hikes soonish.

The key words: In its statement after Februaryâ€™s meeting, the Fed said it expected to enact â€œongoing increasesâ€ in rates to combat inflation. But yesterday, it swapped that language out for â€œsome additional policy firming may be appropriate.â€ Yes, weâ€™re getting into the fine print, but when it comes to Fed statements, small tweaks make a big difference. This change is a sign that rate hikes could be winding down.

The banking chaos is a big reason why

Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that â€œserious difficulties at a small number of banksâ€ have emerged, which is a reference to the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and its ripple effects across the sector.

While it sounds bizarre, the banking turmoil seems to have done some of the Fedâ€™s work for it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C87e7f7e1>. Hereâ€™s how:

The Fed had been hiking interest rates to curb borrowing and, in turn, slow down the economy and inflation.

SVBâ€™s implosion seems to have done precisely that. As banks hunker down during the storm, itâ€™s â€œlikely to result in tighter credit conditions for households and businesses and to weigh on economic activity, hiring, and inflation,â€ the Fed wrote.

All of that is not good for the economy, of course, but it could help lower price growth when inflation is still ripping at 6%.

Big picture: Powell has other things besides interest rates to worry aboutâ€”specifically, job security. Heâ€™s been taking heat from lawmakers across the political spectrum over the blowup of several banks on his watch. Politicians as diametrically opposed as conservative Sen. Rick Scott and progressive Sen. Elizabeth Warren have laid the blame for the banking failures at Powellâ€™s feet, arguing that he failed to properly regulate banks in the lead-up to their collapse.

In response to criticism, Powell went full Bart Simpson on a chalkboard yesterday, saying that the Fed is â€œcommitted to learning the lessons from this episode, and to work to prevent episodes from events like this from happening again.â€â€”NF

WORLD

Tour de headlines
ğŸ©» The organ transplant system is getting overhauled. The Biden administration unveiled a plan <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cde8bece8> yesterday to revamp the problem-ridden system for organ transplants. One nonprofit, United Network for Organ Sharing, has had a monopoly on running the system for nearly four decades, but the governmentâ€™s proposal includes potentially bringing more organizations in, as well as upping funding and modernizing the computer systems involved. There are ~104,000 people currently waiting for an organ transplant, and 17 people die per day while waiting.

TikTokâ€™s CEO will tell Congress the appâ€™s no agent of China. Shou Zi Chew will face Congress <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C99e5e23f> today and is likely to be grilled by lawmakers while arguing that the US should not ban or force a sale of Chinese-owned TikTok, which currently boasts 150 million monthly US users. Thesaurus.com was probably the star of yesterdays Supreme Court oral arguments, in which attorneys for Jack Danielâ€™s had to use every synonym for â€œdog poopâ€ they could find. The whiskey brand argued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30925906.100640/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80NFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkyNTkwNi4xMDA2NDA/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C62fa2f21> that the dog toy company VIP Products violated its trademark with a crude squeaky toy that mimicked its iconic product.

The VIP â€œBad Spanielsâ€ dog toy at the center of the case is modeled after the recognizable whiskey bottle but, instead of saying â€œOld No. 7 Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey,â€ it features â€œOld No. 2 on your Tennessee carpetâ€ in an almost identical font. Jack Danielâ€™s claims that the toyâ€™s similarity to the real product confuses customers and associates â€œfine whiskey with dog poop.â€ VIP says its toy is a parody protected as creative expression.

A district court sided with the whiskey-maker, but an appeals court said that, because the toy was a parody, extra care had to be taken to make sure that enforcing the trademark didnâ€™t run afoul of the First Amendment. The appeals court then found VIP could keep making the toy.

Bottom line: Whether the high court sides with the toymaker or says the company really stepped in it, the decision could redefine how far federal trademark protections reach when humor is involved.â€”MM

Interesting fact: Because Ramadan is linked to a lunar calendar, it begins 10â€“12 days earlier each yearâ€”so the next time it will start around this date wonâ€™t be until 2056. And the year 2030 will have two Ramadan observances, one beginning on Jan. 5 and the next on Dec. 25.

Dramatic Fed meeting: Chair Jerome Powell is in the hot seat today as he makes an interest-rate decision with global ramifications. The Fed will need to decide whether to continue raising interest rates to combat still-soaring inflation or hit the brakes to ease the pressure building on banks. Powellâ€™s decision will influence how central bankers worldwide approach monetary policy in this dicey moment.

Yesterday, Google began rolling out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca4f97ac6> its chatbot, Bard, to select US and UK users and plans to open it up to more people going forward (you can get on the waitlist here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3bf63891>).

Like its AI competitor ChatGPT, Bard can answer your questions in a humanlike, conversational tone. But Google, which has rolled out its AI tech more methodically than rival Microsoft, is stressing that Bard is still an â€œearly experimentâ€ and wants users to play around with it so the company can learn what needs to be fixed.

One thing users will definitely encounter is blatantly wrong information. So to cover its butt, Google has included a warning in the main text box: â€œBard may display inaccurate or offensive information that doesnâ€™t represent Googleâ€™s views.â€ In fact, the entire Bard experience has more disclaimers than a white-water rafting trip, highlighting Googleâ€™s â€œuse at your own riskâ€ approach.

Big picture: Google is pitching Bard as a complement to its search businessâ€”not a replacement. As the dominant leader in search, Google must be careful with how it deploys AI: It canâ€™t cannibalize searchâ€™s business model, but it also canâ€™t allow the competition to disrupt search, either.

Deflation has finally come for the housing market: For the first time in 131 months, the median price of a home in the US fell <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6b78b188> on an annual basis. Home sales also surged 14.5% from January to February, snapping a yearlong decline and increasing the most since July 2020.

What happens when â€˜Natureâ€™ wades into politics? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da2c8de9a> Biden looking bemused <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80MjI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea2c8de9a> Drew Angerer/Getty Images
Natureâ€™s endorsement of Joe Biden for president in 2020 probably hurt Nature <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30913583.2937447/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy80Mmw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkxMzU4My4yOTM3NDQ3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C997ffd5f> and barely helped Biden, according to new research.

In the lead-up to the election, the prestigious scientific journal accused former President Trump of neglecting science in his handling of Covid and climate change and threw its support behind Biden. But a study published this week concluded that the move could have undermined public trust in Nature and science more broadly.

The nuts and bolts: Stanford political economist Floyd Jiuyun Zhang surveyed 4,260 people (mostly supporters of Biden or Trump) in the summer of 2021 to better understand how scientists taking a partisan stance might affect their credibility with the public. Half of the participants were shown Natureâ€™s statement endorsing Biden, while the other half was asked to read an announcement from the journal that had nothing to do with politics.

What we learned: Reading Natureâ€™s endorsement of Biden was unlikely to turn someone into a supporter of him, but it did make some Trump fans skeptical of Nature and more distrustful of scientists in general.

Nature stood by its campaign advocacy. It claims the scientific community has an obligation to take a stand against politicians who â€œthreaten a retreat from reason.â€â€”SK

GOVERNMENT

You never forget your firstâ€¦veto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dce1e21b2> Biden <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ece1e21b2> Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images
Biden checked-â€˜nâ€™-balanced Congress yesterday with the first veto of his presidency. The president nixed a bill that wouldâ€™ve overturned a Labor Department rule allowing retirement fund managers to consider environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in their investment choices.

Why pick this fight?

ESG investments take social and social and environmental impacts: Investment choices are based on considerations like companiesâ€™ carbon emissions and executive pay, in addition to potential returns.

Opposing ESG investing has become as much of a cultural marker for Republicans as listening to All Things Considered is for Democrats. The anti-ESG bill was introduced by Republicans in the House.

GOP lawmakers want investment fund managers to focus exclusively on growing clientsâ€™ retirement savings by maximizing returns rather than advancing what they see as â€œwokeâ€ goals. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy accused Biden promoting ESG to â€œfund a far-left political agenda.â€

Democrats say itâ€™s important that fund managers have the option to focus on ESG. They argue that the dichotomy between social goals and investment returns is often false since the former can influence a companyâ€™s economic prospects over the long haul.

How did we get here?

During the Trump administration, the Labor Department moved to substantially limit ESG practices for 401(k) funds, but the Biden administration reversed course and made a rule to explicitly allow fund managers to incorporate ESG principles into their investment strategy. Republican lawmakers in both chambers supported the bill to reverse this policy, and Democrats overwhelmingly opposed it (aside from Senators Joe Manchin and Jon Tester and Rep. Jared Golden, who crossed party lines to vote â€œyeaâ€).

Bidenâ€™s veto did not come as a surprise (he threatened to do it before the bill passed), but Republicans hope that passing the bill through Congress lays the foundation for a court battle that can get the rule thrown out.

Zoom out: So far, Biden has kept the presidential flexing to a minimum, compared to his predecessorâ€™s 10 vetoes over four years and FDRâ€™s record 372 vetoes inâ€¦12 years.â€”SK

Amazon will lay off another 9,000 staffers. The e-commerce giant recently finished letting go of 18,000 employees, but itâ€™s already announcing another round of job cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cca194adf> to reduce spending. The reductions come after Amazonâ€™s ranks swelled to help the company meet surging demand when nobody could go to stores during the pandemic.

Xi Jinping is visiting â€œdear friendâ€ Vladimir Putin. Chinaâ€™s leader began a three-day visit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C990a92a0> to Russia yesterday, meeting with Putin even as the West tries to keep Russia isolated because of its invasion of Ukraine. The US is concerned China may try to sell weapons to Russia or push a peace deal that leaves Russian troops in Ukraine.

CDC issues warning on fungus. In a possible inspiration for future seasons of The Last of Us, the CDC said yesterday that a fungal threat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zWDA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf7b86860> to human health is growing at â€œan alarming rateâ€ in health facilities across the US. Candida auris, a drug-resistant and sometimes deadly fungus that grows as a yeast, has now been detected in more than half of all states after first being found in the US in 2016. The fungus can cause infections and is especially dangerous for older people and people with weakened immune systems.

UBSâ€™s emergency takeover <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab0bd7f2> of Credit Suisse may have been necessary to avert a financial crisis, but at least one group is Yosemite Sam-level angry over how the deal shook out.

Investors holding $17 billion worth of Credit Suisseâ€™s additional tier-one bonds were shocked to discover that their $17 billion was now worth a grand total ofâ€¦$0. The value of those bonds had been completely wiped out in the deal.

Quick background: Additional tier-one bonds, or AT1 bonds for short, were established after the 2008 financial crisis to reduce the likelihood that taxpayers would have to bail out a failed bank. AT1s are considered riskier assets, but with that risk comes higher potential returns.

So, if these bondholders knew they were taking on risk, why are they so upset? Mainly because, in this unusual deal, they got wiped out while shareholders didnâ€™t. Thatâ€™s not how the order of operations usually works:

When a write-down happens, shareholders traditionally suffer losses before bondholders get hit.

This deal flipped the food chain, and livid AT1 bondholders are now huddling up with lawyers about potential legal action.

Big picture: The Swiss governmentâ€™s arrangement of the UBSâ€“Credit Suisse deal has been bashed not only by AT1 bondholders, but also by lawmakers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30900128.2951298/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zV0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDkwMDEyOC4yOTUxMjk4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C801217a4> in Switzerlandâ€™s two biggest political parties and financial regulators from around the globe.â€”NF

Markets: The stock market has entered its Harvey Dent era. On the one hand, surging tech stocks pushed the Nasdaq to its best week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38eb5722> since January last week. On the other, global banks have shed $459 billion in market value this month alone, the Financial Times calculates, as the sector faces a growing crisis of confidence.

BANKING

The Swiss call time on Credit Suisse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5a57eab3> Credit Suisse headquarters <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5a57eab3> Arnd Wiegmann/Getty Images
Another weekend, another mad scramble to prevent a banking crisis.

Just one week after US officials raced to backstop Silicon Valley Bank depositors, Swiss authorities sprinted to engineer a takeover of spiraling Credit Suisse before the markets opened on Monday.

They got it done: Swiss banking giant UBS will buy its rival Credit Suisse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca989a81c> for more than $3 billion in a historic tie-up of the countryâ€™s storied banks. Itâ€™s one of the most significant banking events in years, marking the first merger between systemically important global banks since the 2008 financial crisis.

How we got here: Credit Suisse had experienced massive outflows last week (up to $10 billion per day, according to the WSJ) and was teetering on collapse. An uncontrolled implosion of Credit Suisse would have had â€œincalculable consequences for the country and the international financial system,â€ Swiss President Alain Berset said. In other words, if Credit Suisse came crashing down, it would have brought many others with it.

UBS didnâ€™t exactly volunteer as tribute

Understanding the market calamity that wouldâ€™ve occurred otherwise, Swiss regulators essentially forced UBS to go through with this purchase and offered the bank $108.8 billion in liquidity as a way of saying â€œthanks for preventing a global financial crisis .â€

For Credit Suisse, itâ€™s an inglorious end. The iconic financial institution had been badly mismanaged for years, and its measly sale price reflects its fall from grace. Valued at ~$8.5 billion at market close on Friday, Credit Suisse sold for significantly less than half of that.

To put the price tag in perspective, Crocs is worth more than twice as much as what Credit Suisse was bought for.

No disrespect to Crocs, but Credit Suisse has been around for 166 years and had $574 billion in total assets at the end of 2022. This is a stunning collapse of a once-revered bank.

So, whatâ€™s it all mean? Just like US authorities did last weekend, Swiss regulators moved rapidly to nip a spiraling crisis in the bud, employing a â€œletâ€™s do what needs to be done and worry about the consequences laterâ€ approach. Itâ€™s unclear whether these last-ditch government efforts will shore up confidence in a sector thatâ€™s had its world turned upside down in less than two weeks.

TOGETHER WITH THE RIDGE

Elizabeth Warren said bumping it up â€œis a good move.â€ Opponents of raising the cap say it would only increase risk-taking and bad behavior by banks. Some even argue we should lower it <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfebf7698>.

ENVIRONMENT

An enormous seaweed blob heads for Florida <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D3b55bcc4> Beachgoers walk past seaweed that washed ashore on March 16, 2023 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E3b55bcc4> Joe Raedle/Getty Images
Seems like everyone is moving to Florida these daysâ€”including a gigantic blob of seaweed almost twice the width of the contiguous US.

The blob, comprised of 10 tons of sargassum algae, is trekking across the Caribbean toward Florida and is already washing up <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2f74d66> in places like Key West. Local communities across the Gulf of Mexico are worried the seaweed will force them to close popular tourism sites during the peak summer months.

Thatâ€™s because when the seaweed piles up on a beach, it becomes a huge headacheâ€”literally.

Out of the water, sargassum rots and releases chemicals that smell like rotten eggs. Those chemicals also present a risk for people with respiratory issues.

And then thereâ€™s the sheer volume of seaweed. Sargassum is piling up five- to six feet deep <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30888583.2938895/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zU0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg4ODU4My4yOTM4ODk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C25c08db1> on Caribbean beaches, and Barbados needs to employ 1,600 dump trucks a day to haul it away, Brian Lapointe, an oceanographer at Florida Atlantic University, told CNN.

Big picture: Sargassum blooms are not new, and they provide an important habitat for marine life as they move across the ocean. But, due to a variety of factors scientists havenâ€™t fully grasped yet, the blobs have gotten much bigger since 2011. This yearâ€™s blob could break records.

FROM THE CREW

AI in clinical trials
The Crew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2616daf8>
Drug costs are unsustainably high in the US, but using AI in the recruitment phase of clinical trials could play a hand in lowering them. While it might seem like something out ofÂ The Matrix, Healthcare Brew <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbf9576c1> reports that by using AI tools to identify qualified patients, researchers can drastically reduce how long it takes for a new drug or device to hit the market.

Check out their full report here <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30873753.3348347/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8zUjA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDg3Mzc1My4zMzQ4MzQ3JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb4b3673>.
