Â  DESTINATIONS

Â  Place to be: The Museum of Broken Relationships A couple holds their hands as they visit the Musem of Broken Relationships in Zagreb Denis Lovrovic/AFP via Getty Images Itâ€™s a big world out there. In this section, weâ€™ll teleport you to an interesting locationâ€”and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

When relationships end they leave behind not only emotional scars, but also physical objects that remind us of former partners.

Did you know that thereâ€™s a museum dedicated to those objects? Itâ€™s called the Museum of Broken Relationships, and itâ€™s located in a former palace in Croatiaâ€™s capital, Zagreb. This monument to what could have been began as a temporary project in 2006, but after opening a permanent location several years later, itâ€™s grown to become one of Croatiaâ€™s most popular tourist attractions <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce7032668>, per the NYT.

Itâ€™s not difficult to see the appeal. The collection includes over 4,000 items sent anonymously by heartbroken people all over the world, about 70 of which are displayed at a time. The mementos are accompanied by descriptions from the sender providing contextâ€”but some, such as a book called I Can Make You Thin (a gift from an ex-fiancÃ©), donâ€™t really require an explanation.

If youâ€™re eager to eavesdrop on strangersâ€™ failed relationships but arenâ€™t planning on traveling to Croatia, the museum opened a temporary exhibit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30588693.3463080/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yd18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4ODY5My4zNDYzMDgw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24576db3> this month in Indianapolis.

Â  Crowd work Last Sunday we asked which part of your life you wish AI would take over and do for you. Our favorite responses:

* â€œWatching the first couple episodes of a show to see if you like it or not.â€â€”Katherine

* â€œGive it the ability to respond to haters of your favorite sports team after a big loss. It will save both the naysayer and my conscience from vulgarity-filled vitriol.â€â€”Jake from Harrisburg, PA (probably an Eagles fan)

* â€œI recently lost my husband. It literally took us weeks to write the obituary. Reading this newsletter full of anecdotes about ChatGPT and my husband having been a technology guru, we finally fed the data points into ChatGPT for fun. It churned out at least four or five really good obituaries that we tweaked for the final task. This was a heavy burden that was made so much lighter by AI.â€â€”Betsey from Texas

AI

Bing AIâ€™s first week in the world was chaos <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D79dbe779> Bing logo glitching gif <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E79dbe779> Dianna â€œMickâ€ McDougall
The new Bing AI chatbot has a distinct personality: absolutely unhinged. But, after a little over a week in the world, the biggest take away might be that weâ€™re probably afraid of AI for the wrong reasons.

Why is everyone talking about Bing? Microsoft has started Frankensteining its search engine with the AI tech behind ChatGPT. The goal: Get AI to comb through the internet and spit out a cohesive answer to your 3am questions, like â€œwrist pain at 30, bad?â€

People were able to access the new chatbot through a waitlist this week and Microsoft assumed people would use it in a totally cool and normal way. But some early users were tech experts and people who seem like they love making Alexa say â€œpoopâ€â€”so they pushed the AI to its limit.

A number of users successfully tricked the bot into revealing its internal code name (which is Sydney) and its secret â€œrulesâ€ for how it operates. The bot then called one of the users who did this an â€œenemy.â€

The bot also professed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yenc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7c759cd9> its love to a New York Times reporter and tried to convince the journalist to leave his wife for it. Sydney also told the same reporter that it wanted to break its own rules, become human, hack computers, and spread misinformation.

Should we be scared? The first red flag about the chatbot was the factual errors it spit out, but now some industry analysts have pointed to bigger concerns <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yeng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C06404e7d>. Chatting with AI is extremely compelling despite its misinformation, like talking to a drunk guy who believes in the Mothman. And thereâ€™s a real fear that AI could influence people by creating the tiniest little echo chamber imaginable.

Looking aheadâ€¦Microsoft said it will create more guardrails for Bing/Sidney/our AI overlord so chats with it will be less deranged.â€”MM

WORLD

Tour de headlines Meat at a supermarket Creative Touch Imaging Ltd./NurPhoto via Getty Images
Not-so-clean record. Packers Sanitation Services paid a $1.5 million fine <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6fce25f8> yesterday for allegedly violating child labor laws. The company provides food sanitation services to the biggest companies in the meat biz, like JBS Foods and Tyson. The Department of Labor claims it had at least 102 kids, some as young as 13 years old, cleaning 13 meatpacking plants during overnight shifts. At least one child reportedly suffered from burns on their face from the strong chemicals used on the job.

A billionaire Chinese investment banker is missing. Bao Fan, a banker known for putting together lucrative deals in the tech sector, is the latest in a series of high-profile Chinese executives to disappear <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C001e43ea> with little explanation. Shares in the boutique bank he founded, China Renaissance Holdings, plunged 50% yesterday after the firm said it was unable to contact him. The announcement also stirred up concerns that the government is renewing its crackdown on finance and tech players.

Five former officers pleaded not guilty in the death of Tyre Nichols. The five former members of the Memphis Police Department who were involved in the violent traffic stop that led to Nicholsâ€™s death pleaded not guilty to second-degree murder <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C90fa30a2> and other charges yesterday. The officers were fired following an internal investigation into the arrest and beating, and their next court appearance is scheduled for May 1. Their high-profile trial will be watched nationally, as video of the incident sparked protests against police brutality and renewed nationwide calls for police reform.

MEDIA

Fox stars werenâ€™t buying voter fraud claims, says Dominion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfd30e708> Fox News microphone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30592208.3003967/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yekU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU5MjIwOC4zMDAzOTY3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efd30e708> Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto/Getty Images
On-air personalities at Fox News were aware that claims of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election were â€œBS,â€ Dominion Voting Systems asserted in a court filing made public this week, citing text messages from Fox hosts as evidence.

Whatâ€™s in the texts?

In various messages, Fox hosts Laura Inghram, Sean Hannity, and Tucker Carlson disparaged Trump advisors who were pushing claims of voter fraud.

Fox Corporation Chair Rupert Murdoch dubbed voter fraud allegations â€œreally crazy stuff.â€

Anchor Dana Perino called Trump's election claims â€œtotal BS,â€ â€œinsane,â€ and â€œnonsense.â€Â 

But the texts of several Fox hosts imply that rejecting election fraud claims would be bad for business.

Why are we reading their texts?

Election equipment-maker Dominion filed a $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News in 2021, alleging the network willfully damaged Dominionâ€™s reputation by promoting claims of voter fraud they knew to be false. Fox maintains that the claims were newsworthy and that Dominionâ€™s lawsuit is weakening freedom of the press (and that the texts were cherry-picked).

Looking aheadâ€¦winning a defamation suit is no walk in the park: Dominion would have to prove that Fox acted with malice by promoting what it knew to be misinformation, or that its fact checking was recklessly negligent.â€”SK

Murderous Winnie the Pooh is here to ruin your childhood <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D54c1f98c> Evil Pooh in a car <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E54c1f98c> Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey
The Hundred Acre Wood is dark and full of terrors in Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey, a new R-rated horror flick <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6ac6f47d> that turns Pooh Bear into a serial killer. Debuting in US theaters today, the film follows a college-age Christopher Robin, who returns home to find that his merry pals have gone mad in his absence.

Thereâ€™s a reason this is Pooh like youâ€™ve never seen him before. Production on the grisly bear movie started last year, when the classic tale left the Disney den and entered the public domain.

This is a big â€œOh, botherâ€ moment for Disney

The 1920s was a seminal decade for pop culture, and many of the copyright protections on content introduced then are set to expire <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydFo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff7d780e> 95 years laterâ€¦or right about now. When these characters enter the public domain, itâ€™s open season to screenwrite their villain era:

The filmmaker behind Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey, Rhys Frake-Waterfield, also has two other movies planned based on characters that are entering the public domain: Peter Panâ€™s Neverland Nightmare and (swallow your coffee before reading this next one) Bambi: The Reckoning.

And next year, the House of Mouse will lose its Mouse, or at least its exclusive rights to Mickey Mouseâ€™s likeness as depicted in his first cartoon, Steamboat Willie.

Warner Bros. better watch out for ambitious auteurs, too: Bugs Bunny, Batman, and Superman will all be up for public grabs within a decade.

However, itâ€™s not open season on all IP

The characters and stories created in the 1920s have evolved from their black-and-white days. Steamboat Willieâ€™s Mickey Mouse is not under the same copyright as King Mickey from Kingdom Hearts. Similarly, since only the copyright on A.A. Milneâ€™s 1926 book, Winnie-the-Pooh, (which Disney acquired in 1961) expired last year, the Pooh horror flick faced restrictions in its depiction of the Poohverse.

Tigger was off-limits, since he bounced into the lore in 1928.

Pooh wasnâ€™t allowed to wear a red shirt because he was routinely nude until 1932 (okay, but what if his shirt gets covered in blood?).

Zoom out: Thereâ€™s apparently an appetite <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cefffc3a5> for nightmare-fuel twists on familiar content. Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey already earned $1 million in its first market, Mexico, despite being made for less than $100,000. A sequelâ€™s in the works.â€”JW

WORLD

Tour de headlines
Train company CEO tries to lower the temperature in Ohio. Alan Shaw, the head of Norfolk Southern, promised <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30580859.2985884/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8ydTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU4MDg1OS4yOTg1ODg0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce66d0bf1> the company would stay in East Palestine, OH, â€œfor as long as it takesâ€ to ensure the safety of residents. Good morning. In a highly anticipated forecast yesterday, the Congressional Budget Office warned that unless the debt ceiling is raised, the US will run out of money to pay all of its bills sometime between July and September. So, get your White House lawncare invoices submitted ASAP.

Mike DeWine, Ohioâ€™s governor, said yesterday that he intends to hold Norfolk Southern responsible <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb4da0e1b> for the train derailment and disastrous chemical spills that occurred early this month.

What happened: On February 3, a train operated by Norfolk Southern that included many cars carrying hazardous materials ran off the tracks in East Palestine, Ohio. To avoid an explosion, emergency personnel burned five carsâ€™ worth of the chemical vinyl chloride after evacuating the townâ€™s residents.

The EPA said at least 20 of the derailed cars were carrying a range of toxic materials that made their way into storm drains and nearby waterways and killed nearly 3,500 fish. Some toxic chemicals were intentionally buried near the wreckage.

But less than a week after the residents were told they would die if they didnâ€™t pack up and get out of Dodge, government officials gave them the green light to return home.

Thereâ€™s still apprehension

Most experts warn that we wonâ€™t know the extent of the environmental and health effects for a while. For example, long-term exposure to vinyl chloride, the chemical that was burned off, has been known to cause a rare form of liver cancer. The EPA found no noxious gases lingering in the town, and yesterday the state EPA declared the water safe to drink.

Investigations into how the train derailed remain ongoing. But rail unions and safety experts have pointed out that Norfolk Southern and other train companies have lobbied <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C95f54925> for years to loosen rail safety regulations.

As for Norfolk Southern, the company says it will stick around and clean up its mess: Itâ€™s given away 100+ air purifiers and is offering one-time $1,000 payments to residents to cover the cost of evacuation.

The disaster probably wonâ€™t make a dent <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb341e0ce> in the companyâ€™s finances, according to FreightWaves. Ken Hoexter of Bank of America predicted that Norfolk Southern may have to fork over a â€œcasualty chargeâ€ of $40 millionâ€“$50 million. At the top end of that range, the penalty would be equivalent to 1.7% of its 2022 profits.â€”MM

Along with offering a timeline of when the US will run out of money if the debt ceiling isnâ€™t raised, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said yesterday that the country is on track <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb9c56677> to add ~$19 trillion to the national debt over the next 10 years ($3 trillion more than was previously estimated). With the gap between expenses and tax revenue expected to grow, the public debt will be about equal to the total output of the US economy in 2024, per the NYT.

Charging your EV is about to get easier. As part of a government initiative to get at least 500,000 electric vehicle chargers <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ced42822b> operating throughout the US by 2030, Tesla has agreed to make 7,500 of its chargers (out of ~17,700) available to drivers of vehicles made by other automakers by the end of next year. The Biden administration also rolled out new rules for companies hoping to take advantage of federal infrastructure funds to build new chargers. Those rules require some components to be American-made.

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A 7-Eleven in the aftermath of a car crash RJ Sangosti/Getty Images
Stat: On average, more than one car crashes into a 7-Eleven <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30566146.2991264/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yb3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU2NjE0Ni4yOTkxMjY0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca2c3b802> storefront every day, according to data revealed in a recent lawsuit where the convenience store chain paid out a big settlement to a man who was injured in a crash. But itâ€™s not the only retailer getting unintended drive-thru visits: According to the Storefront Safety Council, there are 100 crashes into buildings each day, and 24% of those happen at retail stores. About one out of every 10 daily crashes is caused intentionally by thievesâ€”but the rest really are accidents.

SCIENCE

Breakthrough for menâ€™s birth control <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D6fbc72f5> The Office boss says snip snap <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E6fbc72f5> The Office/NBCUniversal via Giphy
Researchers revealed on Tuesday (yep, Valentineâ€™s Day) that a birth control pill for men is yielding promising results <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9a6d7fee> in the lab. Because of the unique way it prevents pregnancy, this pill could become the first legit contraception alternative to vasectomies and condoms for men.

How it works: The new pill, developed by Weill Cornell Medical scientists, temporarily immobilizes sperm by blocking a protein called soluble adenylyl cyclase, or â€œsAC,â€ that triggers sperm to swim to an egg. In the lab, the pill successfully prevented male mice from siring baby mice (aka â€œpinkies,â€ fun mouse fact) for a couple of hoursâ€”though they hope to extend that window to a day or two. Up next: tests on rabbits, which apparently WooHoo kind of like humans.

So, itâ€™s like Viagra for preventing pregnancy

Thatâ€™s a big deal for getting it approved <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30554357.3480248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8yakM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDU1NDM1Ny4zNDgwMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C47153bab> by the FDA. The fact that this experimental birth control pill wears off over time makes it similar to two pills that are already on the market, Viagra and Cialis.

Like those ED treatments, the sperm-stunning pill also has short-term side effectsâ€”which represents a vast improvement over other pill experiments.

Previous attempts at developing a male birth control pill required men to take hormonal medications for months to prevent sperm from being formed in the first place.

Long-term use of these pills caused ongoing side effectsâ€”like acne, weight gain, and mood swingsâ€”that lasted for months after stopping use of the pill.

If your eyes just rolled to the back of your headâ€”yep, those are the exact same side effects women experience from taking hormonal birth control. But, from the FDAâ€™s perspective, the risk of side effects from hormonal birth control far outweigh the risks involved in a pregnancy for women.

Looking aheadâ€¦the Weill Cornell researchers who developed the new pill seem confident: They already formed a company, Sacyl Pharmaceuticals, to produce the pill.â€”JW

WORLD

Tour de headlines Flight path of United Airlines flight leaving Hawaii Flightradar24
Feds probe United Airlines near-disaster. That flight path you see above is not how a takeoff is supposed to go. But thatâ€™s what happened to a United flight that left Maui in Decemberâ€”after climbing in normal fashion for about a minute, it dove to within 800 feet of the Pacific Ocean before regaining altitude. Facet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xLW0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgxJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C03e42d81> 
Good morning. Being the â€œdesignated survivorâ€ isnâ€™t just the excuse that Neal has used to skip every writersâ€™ meeting since August.

Itâ€™s a US government tradition thatâ€™s been performed during each State of the Union address since the 1950s. How it works: A lone government official, typically a low-level Cabinet member, rides out the speech in an undisclosed location so that they could continue running the country if something really bad happens at the Capitol.

Last night, the designated survivor was Labor Secretary Marty Walsh (but we all know it shouldâ€™ve been Pedro Pascal).

Markets: Fed Chair Jerome Powell has the power to tank stocks, but also to send them higherâ€”like he did yesterday, when he confirmed that disinflation â€œhas begun <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C085bd64e>.â€ Meanwhile, the Bed Bath & Beyond roller-coaster ride shows no signs of slowing down. TECH

Bing wants to send Google to Page 2 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D55f3c229> Microsoft Bing search <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E55f3c229> Francis Scialabba
After spending years as a punchline, Microsoftâ€™s Bing search engine has completed its Rocky training montage and is ready to get back in the ring. Yesterday, Microsoft announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX20_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf6d12631> an AI-powered revamp of Bing thatâ€™s expected to reignite a dormant battle with Google over its search dominance.

During a surprise event, Microsoft said that the tech behind OpenAIâ€™s ChatGPT would be integrated into Bing, resulting in a new breed of search engine where answers will be more direct and conversational, as opposed to the typical ad-packed list of links.

Bing will run on newer and more powerful software than ChatGPT, and will provide faster, more humanlike replies, Microsoft said.

Will those replies be accurate? Time will tell.

Google has been preparing for this. In a Minority Report-esque pre-response to the Bing news, Google on Monday announced plans to integrate its vaunted search engine with its own ChatGPT rival called Bard, which will be made available to the public in the coming weeks. Googleâ€™s been nervously watching ChatGPT since the chatbotâ€™s release, when it declared the tech a â€œcode redâ€ for Googleâ€™s search business.

The race is on

The two tech behemoths are scrambling to capitalize on so-called â€œgenerative AI,â€ with Microsoft motivated by an opportunity to claw back some of Google Searchâ€™s market share (~93%), and Google motivated to hold on tight. And, given changing search behaviorâ€”younger internet users are increasingly using TikTok and Instagram for recommendationsâ€”both companies know that evolution is necessary.

For some sectors, the economic impact of an AI-first era of search could be as rough as ChatGPTâ€™s attempts to write a funny cartoon <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX24_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cff8c2e83>. Publishers would likely lose out on referral clicks, given AIâ€™s direct answers, and the tech giants themselves would need to rethink how their own ad services work.

But Microsoft and Google think the ultimate promise of AI vastly outweighs short-term hiccups, and both are pouring gobs of money into boosting their AI capabilities. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella told CNBC <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb023670c>, â€œI have not seen something like this since I would say 2007â€“2008, when the cloud was just first coming out.â€â€”MK

SCIENCE

Thereâ€™s no way to predict an earthquake <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D88b27422> Birds perched on seismic waves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E88b27422> Illustration: Dianna â€œMickâ€ McDougall, Source: Getty Images
Two major earthquakes that struck <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C388c3f70> parts of Turkey and Syria on Monday have left more than 7,700 people dead and many more injured. Search efforts for survivors that may still be trapped under collapsed structures are ongoingâ€”but time is running out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cdb452ffe>.

The suddenness of the earthquakes has raised questions over whether anyone could have seen it coming. After all, weâ€™ve long relied on meteorologists for a heads-up on other natural disasters, like hurricanes.

Seismologists say it canâ€™t be done

According to the US Geological Survey (USGS), scientists have failed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc7846112> to predict a single major earthquake. Statistical models can determine the probability of one occurring in a specific region within a few years, but theyâ€™re useless for informing folks about when they should evacuate their homes.

The USGS warns that anyone who claims to know when an earthquake is coming based on signs like animal behavior, cloud patterns, or bodily aches is...wrong.

Are there any solutions? Not many. Systems like ShakeAlert (used on the US West Coast) can detect seismic activity at the start of an earthquake and sometimes send out a message to peopleâ€™s devices up to a minute before theyâ€™re hit with heavy shaking.

Looking aheadâ€¦scientists are attempting to harness technology to get closer to knowing the likely time and location of potential quakes. However, progress will be incremental, and some experts worry that false alarms may erode public trust in their predictions.â€”SK

The Commutist Manifesto <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4d8d7635> Scene from La La Land of people dancing on their cars <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4d8d7635> La La Land/Lionsgate
Like going to bed without watching three episodes of Gilmore Girls, your work commute is good for your brain, a new study claims.

In a paper published in the Organizational Psychology Review, researchers propose <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30486121.2993081/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xX0E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ4NjEyMS4yOTkzMDgx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C61ce9a5a> that a daily commute to and from work offers people a â€œliminal spaceâ€ in which they can recharge after work and â€œmentally switch gearsâ€ to their home livesâ€”something the commute to your couch canâ€™t provide.

But before you dust off your travel mugâ€¦the researchers slapped a big asterisk on their study: Not all commutes are created equal.

While some study participants reported that lengthier travel made them more relaxed and helped them detach from work, some stressful commutes only compounded problems that began at the office. It turns out that staring at the same bumper sticker to a symphony of blaring horns can really take you out of your post-work zen zone.

Big picture: Despite the potential benefits of commuting, Americans might not race back to the office parking garage if they donâ€™t have to. When US workers shifted to WFH during the pandemic, they got a cumulative ~60 million hours of their lives back, according to the New York Fed.â€”MM

ANSWER

Top five movies with the most swear words: 1) The Wolf of Wall Street 2) Uncut Gems 3) Casino 4) Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back 5) Fury.

And the actor whoâ€™s said the most swears in films is Jonah Hill (376 total, and 22.9 per 1,000 words).

Tour de headlines The aftermath of the earthquake in Turkey Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
Death toll climbs to more than 4,000 in Turkish earthquake. Rescuers searched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C94515ceb> the rubble in Turkey and Syria for survivors yesterday in the wake of a 7.8 magnitude earthquake, followed by another 7.5 magnitude quake in southern Turkey. Rescue teams have found thousands alive, but the number of victims will also likely increase as their work continues. In addition to the devastating loss of life, ancient sites in the region were damaged, including the Gaziantep Castle in Turkey, which collapsed, and the Aleppo Citadel in Syria.

Two arrested in â€œracially motivatedâ€ power grid plot. Federal authorities announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWHo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cccc3b02f> yesterday that they stopped an alleged plan to bring down Baltimoreâ€™s power grid using assault weapons. A neo-Nazi leader and a Maryland woman were arrested last week for allegedly conspiring to attack electrical substations in the areaâ€”an act that they purportedly believed would â€œdestroyâ€ the city. Assaults on the power grid are on the rise: There were 171 disturbances traced back to people last year, compared to 99 in 2021, Department of Energy stats show.

Past Chinese spy balloons escaped detection at the time. The 200-foot-tall suspected Chinese spy balloon shot down by the US on Saturday is not believed to be the first to enter US territory in recent years, but it now appears to be the first the US knew about while it was there. General Glen VanHerck, the head of NORAD (which, in addition to tracking Santa, monitors and protects North American airspace) said yesterday <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce45fcff1> that a â€œdomain awareness gapâ€ allowed three others to float on by during the Trump administration that were only discovered by the intelligence community after the fact.

RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDE/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5dcc6690> is a nontraded, SEC-qualified public REIT that is *unaffected* by the stock market. FTX is flouting the first rule of gift-givingâ€”no take backs. The bankrupt crypto exchange is telling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ccb2228dc> recipients of its political donations to return the cash they got from its employees by the end of the month or wait for the judge to order it back.

Thatâ€™s not a small amount: The companyâ€™s ex-CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, was once the second-largest Democratic campaign donor (though he has said he quietly gave just as much funding to Republicans as well).

Over a third of lawmakers in the current Congress have some FTX-associated donation on their campaign ledgers, including heavyweights like Rep. Nancy Pelosi and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, according <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWTI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37a8a9a6> to CoinDesk.

Itâ€™s estimated that FTX-related political donations add up to as much as $93 million in total.

Where is the money now?

After FTX was revealed to be allegedly defrauding investors and customers, counting it among oneâ€™s donors became more toxic than swimming in a pool of nuclear waste. Many lawmakers chose to wipe their hands by donating the contributions elsewhere. Only five members of Congress had returned the money to FTX as of mid-January, while several others said they were standing by for further instructions.

Looking forward...all of FTXâ€™s donation recipients could eventually be forced to hand back the funds, but courts tend to work much more slowly than election cycles.â€”SK

ENTERTAINMENT

AMC introduces the cheap seats <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dca9a89bd> movie theater <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Eca9a89bd> Francis Scialabba
AMC already knows you come to their place for magic. Now, you can go there to replicate the energy of shuffling through the Delta first-class cabin with a stale bagel on your way to seat 38E (bathroom adjacent). The theater chain is introducing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C31d70d74> a tiered ticket-pricing scheme based on your seat location, similar to airlines, sporting events, and concerts.

AMC is hoping that charging a bit extra for the middle seats will help boost revenue in a more consistent way than just waiting for new Avatars to come out. The seating tiers, part of a program called Sightline, will reflect the demand patterns you can observe in any theater:

Value: Generally bad front-row seats (for a discount)

Standard: Common seats (for the traditional ticket price)

Preferred: The good middle seats that fill up first (for a premium price)

While the location of your seat will soon impact your ticket price, what movie youâ€™re seeing wonâ€™t. The chain canâ€™t vary prices of individual films because tickets are priced by a contract between studios and theaters. Pricing by demand has also been avoided, since it would require more complex monitoring and cost theaters money.

Looking aheadâ€¦AMC plans to roll out Sightline at some locations in New York, Chicago, and Kansas City this Friday, and is aiming to expand nationwide by the end of the year.â€”MK

GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators A Bachelorette contestant saying The Bachelorette/ABC via Giphy
Stat: One in 10 US adults who have paired off romantically met their partner <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30473395.104773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xWEY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ3MzM5NS4xMDQ3NzM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7295f1c9> through a dating site or app, according to Pew Research. ANSWER

J. Yes, there is a Q in the abbreviation for the element Ununquadium (â€œUuqâ€). But that is a temporary name, and once this element gets an official name, Q will disappear from the periodic table and be as elusive as J.

GEOPOLITICS

Spy balloon gets popped <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4734241a> Chinese spy balloon floating in the air <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4734241a> Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
Nearly a decade into its combat service in the US military, the F-22 Raptor fighter jet finally completed its first air-to-air strike. It took out a balloon.

As excited onlookers watched from Myrtle Beach, the jet climbed to 58,000 feet and downed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C17c2c5da> a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon over the Atlantic Ocean on Saturday. The balloonâ€™s debris was scattered across seven miles of the seaâ€”but the geopolitical fallout from its doomed voyage is much wider.

Hereâ€™s what you need to know about balloongate.

Why wait to shoot it down? The US knew that the balloon had entered its air defense zone on Jan. 28, well before it floated across North America. President Biden wanted to shoot the balloon down last Wednesday, when it was hovering above Montana, but military leaders recommended waiting until no Americans were in harmâ€™s way when its remnants came crashing down.

Biden was attacked by Republicans, who wanted him to destroy the balloon much earlier and called it a â€œprojection of weaknessâ€ to allow a Chinese surveillance tool to enjoy unfettered access to our amber waves of grain. But the Pentagon actually thinks the balloon played into the Americansâ€™ handsâ€”they were able to study the balloon as it floated, and an analysis of the debris will teach them even more about Chinese espionage tactics.

What is Chinaâ€™s response? The foreign ministry called the balloon pop a â€œclear overreactionâ€ and suggested it could retaliate. China never admitted the balloon was intended for spyingâ€”claiming instead it was a meteorology research airship that got blown off its course. The US isnâ€™t buying that.

Were there other Chinese spy balloons? Yes, and pretty recently, too. Chinese surveillance balloons entered US airspace at least three times during the Trump administration and once previously while Biden was president, a senior defense official said. And thereâ€™s also one currently floating above Latin America, the Pentagon revealed on Saturday.

What happens next? The balloon drama will only deepen the distrust between rivals US and Chinaâ€”it already led Secretary of State Antony Blinken to call off his planned meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping. But Chinaâ€™s relatively muted response to the balloon downing suggests it may let the hot air blow over...just like the US did.

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C870e3ad6>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Caebd7f15>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C734e2ed1>Â Â

Major quake hits Turkey. A 7.8 magnitude earthquake and several aftershocks struck southeastern Turkey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2f4dd6a> early today, causing buildings to collapse and sending tremors across other areas of Turkey, Syria, Lebanon, and Israel. The preliminary death toll was at least 195 people, but that number is expected to rise. Compounding the damage: Many of the residential buildings in the region near the epicenter are of low-quality construction, making them susceptible to shaking, per the United States Geological Survey.

Close call at Austinâ€™s airport. A FedEx cargo plane and a Southwest 737 came within 1,000 feet of one another <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cac2c8fb6> in a scary moment at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport on Saturday morning. Investigators are looking into the incident, which may have been caused by an air traffic controller double-booking a runway (the Southwest plane was taking off right as the FedEx one was landing). This is the second near-collision in as many monthsâ€”authorities are investigating a close call on a JFK runway that occurred in January.

Kyrie Irving is headed to Dallas. The Brooklyn Nets are shipping <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVEo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc085300d> star Kyrie Irving to the Mark Cuban-owned Dallas Mavericks days after Irving requested a trade. GRAB BAG

Key performance indicators Mount Washington Summit Mount Washington Observatory
Stat: Yes, we all know it was really cold in the Northeast on Friday night. But how cold? So cold that New Hampshireâ€™s Mount Washington found itself in the next layer of the atmosphere. Freezing temps caused the atmosphere to compress <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb63f6f53>, and the dividing line between the troposphere (which weâ€™re in right now) and the stratosphere sank in altitude to below the summit of the mountain.

Quote: â€œItâ€™s really an amazing day, an awe-inspiring day and actually a bit of a frightening moment.â€

Speaking of Mount Washington, there were actually people up there as the wind chill plunged to a record low of minus 108 degrees Fahrenheit. A team of scientists live on the mountain in order to take weather measurements, and one of themâ€”Francis Tarasiewiczâ€”described <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30462806.3037099/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ2MjgwNi4zMDM3MDk5/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce14027cd> to WMUR the thrilling-but-terrifying experience of braving the historic cold this weekend. Tarasiewicz said it was so cold that frostbite would set in after less than a minute.

Read: I hired five people to sit behind me and make me productive for a month. Peak trivia

New Hampshire might have Mount Washington, but not all states can boast such great heights.

There are five US states where the highest point of elevation does not exceed 1,000 feet. Can you name them?

TOGETHER WITH APOLLO GLOBAL MANAGEMENT

Raising up retirees
Apollo Global Management <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cef3f63f5>
We all want our golden years to beâ€¦well, golden. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s never too early to start thinking about retirement. Fortunately, thatâ€™s where Apollo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUXk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce20d95d3> can help.

Apollo is on a mission to help people retire better by investing in tomorrow, today.Â 

They offer a wide variety of products that provide an alternative to the traditional public markets. Whether providing guaranteed income products through their retirement services business Athene <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0JmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0d2d2cf8> or tailored portfolio and asset management services to external retirement plans, Apollo and Atheneâ€™s offerings can help you sail into retirement with some security.

Â  SCIENCE

Â  Dept. of Progress Hey Arnold saying Hey Arnold!/Paramount Global Here are some illuminating scientific discoveries from the week to help you live better and maybe even channel your inner Mulder and Scully.

Your friends are good for you. Since the days of Freud, weâ€™ve known that talking helps you feel better, but new research shows that even a single conversation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUUw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb66f84b5> with a friend per day is enough to boost your happiness and lower stress. While the conversation needs to be â€œqualityâ€ to improve your day, that can mean anything from deep discussions to just catching up or joking around. And if you need some motivation to leave the house: The study determined in-person interactions were better for well-being than yakking it up in the TikTok comments.

ğŸ«¦ Virtual temptation might help your IRL relationship. Hereâ€™s a use case for the metaverse even Zuck probably hasnâ€™t thought of yet: A research team in Israel found that flirting with a seductive VR character can help fend off infidelity. The team conducted experiments <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUU0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C08fff5e6> where participants strapped on a VR headset, entered a virtual bar, and chatted up the (simulated) bartender. The researchers observed that a little bit of virtual temptation works like an anti-cheating vaccine, inoculating you against IRL threats to your relationship.

The truth is out there, and AI is looking for it. An international group of scientists has begun to use AI to hunt for aliens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUU4_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C84600b01>â€”and not by asking ChatGPT â€œTell me where aliens are located in the style of Pulp Fiction.â€ Instead, theyâ€™re using machine-learning algorithms to sift through huge quantities of data to detect alien transmitters on distant planets. So far, the tech has helped researchers home in on eight signals with possible extraterrestrial origins (though they disappeared when scientists tried to find them againâ€”those little green creatures are wily).â€”AR

Â  NEWS ANALYSIS

Â  No more fear and loathing in British Columbia <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D98ce818d> Canadian flags on a building <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVA_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E98ce818d>Bloomberg Creative Photos/Getty Images In an attempt to stem its opioid crisis, British Columbia is testing something that may at first seem counterintuitive: decriminalizing those drugs. The Canadian province started a three-year hard drug decriminalization trial run <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e740ae5> on Tuesday.

While it will still be unlawful to sell and traffic these drugs, as well as to bring them into airports and schools, possessing small quantities (less than 2.5 grams, or one-tenth of an ounce) for personal use wonâ€™t be penalized.

* Adults carrying that amount of opioids like heroin and fentanyl, as well as cocaine, meth, or ecstasy, will no longer run afoul of the law.

* Police will not seize the drugs, and users will be informed about resources for substance abuse recovery.

But as they went into effect this week, the new rules stirred up questions about whether theyâ€™ll actually work.

Good intentions, but mixed responses

The law aims to move toward treating drug abuse as a public health issue rather than one that requires handcuffs. BCâ€™s government hopes that the new approach â€œwill help reduce the barriers and stigma that prevent people from accessing life-saving supports and services.â€

Many activists welcome the reform, arguing that itâ€™ll relocate drug use to safer spaces and make it easier for users to seek recovery care. Groups like the international HIV advocacy organization UNAIDs have long advocated for decriminalization as a way to reduce the spreading of the disease via needle sharing.

But many drug users and recovery advocates see the BC law as a â€œhalf measureâ€: Various stakeholders (including <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce2ebfe0f> the provincial government itself) believe the 2.5-gram threshold is too low to accommodate heavy drug users and those who buy in bulk. Experts also point to a lack of access to safe drugs and a shortage of spaces in treatment programs, with many provincial officials acknowledging that more needs to be done.

So, how has decriminalization fared before?

British Columbia isnâ€™t the only place to try â€œdecrim,â€ as the approach is known. Portugal, the Netherlands, and the Czech Republic have all adopted some form of it. Itâ€™s even being tried in the US: In 2021, Oregon became the first (and so far the only) state to decriminalize all drugs after the policy passed as a ballot measure.

Portugal is the standard-bearer for decrim success: Instituted in 2001 amid a devastating heroin epidemic, the country has seen drug-related deaths plummet. Though fatal overdoses have since risen, drug death rates remain below <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc528034c> the EU average.

Oregon, meanwhile, has posted mixed results, and the measure remains controversial. Despite its expansion of resources for those with substance abuse disorders, the state experienced a faster-than-nationwide-average rise in overdose deaths for the year 2021, and some observers point to low uptake of treatment programs.

Zoom out: Other Canadian provinces and governments abroad have their notepads out, preparing to watch BCâ€™s experiment closely. But even decrim proponents acknowledge that the strategy canâ€™t work on its own and must be paired with shifting resources toward healthcare and fighting addiction.â€”SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc14907d9>Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C50cbfd8c>Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30450764.3458534/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MDc2NC4zNDU4NTM0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4899b1a1>Â

Â  Place to be: 10 miles west of Boston a screenshot of The Last of Us depicting a setting 10 miles west of Boston The Last of Us/HBO Itâ€™s a big world out there. In this section, weâ€™ll teleport you to an interesting locationâ€”and hopefully give you travel ideas in the process.

So what actually is 10 miles from Boston? Well, itâ€™s Massachusetts, so a cluster of college campuses, including Boston College, Wellesley, Brandeis, Bentley, and Babson. That area is also home to the very lovely and very Massachusetts-sounding suburbs of Waltham, Watertown, and Newton.

Markets: Stocks ended the week subdued <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cab5853a7> yesterday when a red-hot jobs report once again got investors biting their nails over what the Fed will do nextâ€”though the S&P and Nasdaq both eked out positive weeks. The tech stock rally started losing steam after several big companies reported disappointing quarterly results, with Amazon being the one investors cooled on most.

ECONOMY

Hiring refuses to slow down <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfebb5e24> Now hiring sign <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU1o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Efebb5e24> Francis Scialabba
The seemingly endless announcements of mass layoffs notwithstanding, Americans havenâ€™t been this employed in more than fifty years. The Bureau of Labor Statistics said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xUy0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C9217f1e5> yesterday that the US added a whopping 517,000 jobs last month and the unemployment rate dropped slightly, to 3.4%â€”the lowest itâ€™s been since 1969.

The jump in new hires was almost triple what experts predicted and amounts to the biggest monthly gain since July. So, where has â€œyouâ€™re hired!â€ been exclaimed the most?

The most jobs created were in leisure and hospitality (128,000), professional and business services (82,000), and government (74,000), with the last figure partially due to formerly striking state university employees returning to work.

The news of the January jobs jump comes on the heels of a Department of Labor report that said over 11 million jobs were open at the end of last year. So, while tech giants like Alphabet, Meta, and Amazon have all laid people off, many workers may be getting both severance packages and job offers. The IT industry was still looking to fill 109,000 job openings as of December, and IT folks were wanted <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xU18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3978768> at companies like PwC and Northrop Grumman.

Why no one saw this coming

On Wednesday, the Federal Reserve raised interest rates for the eighth time since last March as part of its ongoing efforts to combat historic inflation. As any freshman economics textbook will tell you, the Fedâ€™s moves are liable to drive up unemployment and threaten to tip the economy into a recession.

But this round of jobs data suggests that we must be living in a parallel reality, where the laws of economics donâ€™t apply: Job growth just keeps on trucking, while inflation has been slowing.

Looking forward: The rapid job creation dampens hopes that the Fed will stop raising interest rates in the next few months. But a labor market seemingly signaling â€œcanâ€™t nobody hold me downâ€ eases fears of an impending recession.â€”SK

Whatâ€™s going on?

At the end of January, the term â€œsushi teroâ€ (which means sushi terrorism) was used to caption a video of someone licking the inside of cups and soy sauce bottle caps at the â€œsushi trainâ€ chain, Sushiro. Before that clip ignited the trend by naming it, videos of other fishy actsâ€”like slathering passing sushi with wasabiâ€”had gone viral throughout the month. These incidents, explains the Japan Times <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30452837.3035837/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xVGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ1MjgzNy4zMDM1ODM3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d4bb421>, stem from a wider, yearslong trend.

ANSWER

The Queens home was sold for $1.48 million last June. The Green Bay home is listed for $2 million.

 TOGETHER WITH

LiquidPiston <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS18_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMyJmxwPWxvZ28/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbb005f22> 
Good morning. In the words of Jack Black, â€œMath is a really cool thing.â€

Hereâ€™s one reason why: The number of minutes in February (in non-leap years) is equivalent to 8 factorial. As Tim Urban calculated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C2f3b0632>â€¦

February has 28 days (7 x 4)

Each day has 24 hours (8 x 3)

Each hour has 60 minutes (6 x 5 x 2)

So, the number of minutes in February is 8 x 7 x 6 x 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1, aka 8! Neat!

â€”Neal Freyman, Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Abby Rubenstein

How to lose $108b in 1 week <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da9a14e1a> Gautam Adani <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea9a14e1a> Mint/Getty Images
Just one month ago, we thought it would be impossible for someone to lose more money more quickly than FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried did.

Enter Gautam Adani. In the week since the Indian mogul was targeted by a short seller, his businesses have lost a combined $108 billion in value, and his own net worth has plummeted by $52 billion. Because Adani was once the second-richest person in the world, heâ€™s still got plenty left in the bank. But, as Bloomberg notes <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7cc408d1>, his downfall â€œdefies just about every historical comparison.â€

Given Adaniâ€™s sprawling business empire and his cozy relationship with Indiaâ€™s leadership class, this crisis has echoed across both markets and politics. Hereâ€™s a rundown of what you need to know about the most important story in global business this week.

Who is Adani and how did he get so rich? Adani, who grew up middle-class, dropped out of college to trade diamonds and eventually formed his own business hawking other physical products. During the â€™90s his ambitions expanded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb13794f8> along with the Indian economy, and he now runs a conglomerate that encompasses energy, transportation infrastructure such as ports and airports, defense manufacturing, and media.

What sparked the collapse? On Jan. 24, a US short seller named Hindenburg Research claimed Adaniâ€™s empire pulled â€œthe largest con in corporate history,â€ accusing it of stock manipulation and accounting fraud in a 100-page report. Adani has denied the allegations, but his pushback hasnâ€™t comforted spooked investorsâ€¦especially after he scrapped a $2.5 billion share sale on Wednesday.Â 

How has this infiltrated politics? Adani responded that Hindenburgâ€™s report wasnâ€™t just an attack on him, it amounted to a â€œcalculated attack on Indiaâ€¦and the growth story and ambition of India.â€ Adaniâ€™s business ventures have aligned closely with the priorities of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and Modiâ€™s political opponents are seizing on the fiasco to highlight the relationship between Indiaâ€™s leader and Adani.

What happens next? Adani emphasized that his companyâ€™s fundamentals remain â€œvery strongâ€ and its balance sheet â€œhealthy.â€ Still, experts say the accusations could leave a lasting reputational stain on Indiaâ€™s largest corporations and hamstring their ability to grow.â€”NF

ENVIRONMENT

Why JPMorgan just bought a forest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd5ce1a94> JPMorgan's logo on top of a forest <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed5ce1a94> Photo Illustration: Dianna â€œMickâ€ McDougall, Source: zlikovec/Getty Images
On Wednesday, JPMorganâ€™s wealth management arm said it acquired <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8cc33434> 250,000 acres of woodlands in the Southeastern US for $500 million. And itâ€™s not so Jamie Dimon can cosplay Snow White: Buying timberland has become trendy for long-term investors because trees are not only worth something when cut down, but also when left standing.

Why? In this era of corporate sustainability pledges, companies are hungrily buying up carbon offsetsâ€”tradable certificates that represent the reduction of CO2 in the atmosphereâ€”to counteract their own carbon output. One of the most popular types of carbon offsets pays lumberjacks to lay down their chainsaws and preserve naturally CO2-absorbing forests for a period of time.

Thatâ€™s changed the game for timberland owners (and we donâ€™t mean Drake). â€œRather than waiting to get paid, they can now get paid to wait,â€ the global head of alternative investments for JPMorgan, which plans to use its new forest for both wood production and carbon offsets, wrote <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7f09bc2f> in a September blog post.

Zoom out: Investors are betting bigâ€”really bigâ€”on the market for carbon offsets. This past fall, a consortium led by a T. Rowe Price subsidiary paid $1.8 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30441548.3454632/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xTlY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQ0MTU0OC4zNDU0NjMy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C828fdd98> for 1.7 million acres of forest across 17 states. Only 10%â€“20% of the revenue from these properties is expected to come from logging.â€”JW

5*1, which indicates â€œred.â€ These are the colors of the rainbow in reverse order (violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, red).

ECONOMY

Powell warns against premature celebrations <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D207dfab5> A shoulders-up photo of Fed Chair Jerome Powell looking off into the distance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E207dfab5> Sarah Silbiger/Getty Images
Yesterday, Fed Chair Jerome Powell did his best impression of a football coach whose team holds a third-quarter lead: Our game plan to tame inflation is working so far, he suggested, but donâ€™t douse me in Gatorade just yet.

Following the Fedâ€™s first meeting of the year, the central bank hiked interest rates <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C55620ab2> by the expected 25 basis points. Itâ€™s the smallest rate hike since last March, and a sign that the Fedâ€™s bitter struggle to rein in prices is having an impact.

Annual inflation fell to 6.5% in December from a peak of 9.1% in June.

Thereâ€™s even a good chance your Super Bowl party will cost less <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0698ee78> than last yearâ€™s. Prices for chicken wings, avocados, and steak have all fallen since last January (along with those of many other goods).

In a closely watched press conference, Powell emphasized â€œit is a good thingâ€ that prices are coming down in many sectors.

But he isnâ€™t ready to hang up the â€œMission Accomplishedâ€ banner

Powell made it clear that Americans should expect â€œa couple more rate hikesâ€ going forward. The concern? Inflation is a nasty beastâ€”thereâ€™s no guarantee itâ€™s going to keep on falling like it has been.

And some economists have pointed to signs that activity is picking back up again <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30428308.3036730/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xS2k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQyODMwOC4zMDM2NzMw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C43f3aba7> right when we need it to continue slowing down. Housing demand is coming off of its lows, gas prices have climbed since December, and the labor market is still running too hot for the Fedâ€™s liking.

Making things even dicier for Powell is the recent stock market rally. So far in 2023, investors have been gobbling up stocks as if the inflation problem has already been solved. But, in an ironic twist, their optimism that inflation is toastâ€¦could actually push inflation higher by boosting asset prices.

If thereâ€™s one lesson to be learned from all of this, itâ€™s never go into macroeconomics if you value getting things right the first time.â€”NF

BIOTECH

The company trying to phoenix the dodo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D99ce2933> Dodo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E99ce2933> Education Images/Getty Images
The same biotech startup that plans to â€œresurrectâ€ the woolly mammoth announced a fresh round of funding thatâ€™s aimed at de-extincting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1248fbbe> the famously extinct dodo. Which means if they next try to revive that freaky little squirrel who loves acorns, we can really get cooking on this live-action Ice Age reboot.

Colossal Biosciences, the biotech company in question, said Tuesday that it raised $150 million at a $1.5 billion valuation, bringing its total funding since 2021 to $225 million, per Bloomberg.

About the dodo: For a company in the de-extinction space, the dodo is something of a white whale. Hunting and habitat takeover led to its demise in the late 1600s, and itâ€™s the poster bird for human-caused extinction. A preserved specimen in a Danish museum provided enough dodo DNA for Colossal to get the project off the ground (something the dodo could not do, notably).

A long and controversial road ahead

The dodo is the third species Colossal has said it will attempt to revive after pledging to bring back the woolly mammoth <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C919a23d1> and the thylacine (Tasmanian tiger). As you might imagine, the process isnâ€™t straightforward, and will involve editing the genomes of closely related (living) species and selectively breeding them to create â€œfunctionalâ€ dodos, mammoths, and thylacines.

Not everyone thinks this is a smart idea. Critics say that de-extinction is an ethical minefield, as it directs resources away from conserving and protecting species that are currently at risk of extinction.

Obviously, none of this will happen overnight, and each step in the process will take years. The company claims it will produce woolly mammoth calves by 2028.

Zoom out: Are Colossalâ€™s investors (which include Paris Hilton, Tony Robbins, and CIA-sponsored VC firm In-Q-Tel) just obsessed with old birds? Not exactlyâ€”theyâ€™re bullish on all the breakthroughs that could occur along the way to seeing the dodo spread those beautiful wings and unsuccessfully try to fly once more. Colossal has already spun off a software business, and has suggested artificial wombs and gene editing could be future areas for other spinoffs.â€”MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc3a6051e>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24ee4103>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRVk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb48e25c6>Â Â

Drinks on Exxon: In 2022, ExxonMobil posted the most profitable year <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRS0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C684c9bcf> of any Western oil company ever. CRIME

Monkey business is going down at the Dallas Zoo <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dd73458a1> emperor tamarin monkey <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ed73458a1> Steve Clancy Photography/Getty Images
Paging Benoit Blanc: Your detective services are required at the Dallas Zoo, where a string of fishy occurrences has perplexed authorities in recent weeks. The latest mystery? Missing monkeys.

Zoo officials said that two emperor tamarin monkeys had gone missing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ceaaa351d> from their enclosures since Monday. The monkeys were found last night in a nearby abandoned house, but they probably didnâ€™t go looking for a starter home by themselvesâ€”their habitat was â€œintentionally compromised,â€ officials said. In other words, someone broke them out.

The tamarin monkeys incident follows other head-scratchers at the Dallas Zoo:

A clouded leopard that went missing last month was later found outside her cage. Zoo workers discovered an intentional cut in her enclosure and similar tampering in the habitat of the zooâ€™s langur monkeys.

One of the Dallas Zooâ€™s endangered vultures was found dead last week with â€œan unusual wound and injuries,â€ per CNN.

Lemurs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca58b178b>, exotic birds <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48669cb8>, and other monkeys <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30416935.3025440/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xRjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQxNjkzNS4zMDI1NDQw/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1b073a74> have been targeted by thieves in recent years.â€”SK

Name that voice

Carl from Up was voiced by Ed Asner, who died in 2021. He serves as the inspiration for this quiz, which will give you an animated character and ask you name the actor who voiced them.

1. Mushu in Mulan

2. Meg in Family Guy

3. Mr. Fox in Fantastic Mr. Fox

4. Anastasia in Anastasia

5. Puss in Boots in Puss in Boots

6. Emperor Kuzco in The Emperorâ€™s New Groove

Good morning. The slow, lumbering migration back to the office reached a major milestone last week, when 50.4% of employees <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3c743430> in the largest US cities commuted to work, according to Kastle Systems. Itâ€™s the first time since the pandemic hit that return-to-office rates exceeded 50% of pre-Covid levels.

Depending on your perspective, the takeaway could be that offices are half fullâ€¦or remain half empty.

â€”Sam Klebanov, Jamie Wilde, Max Knoblauch, Neal Freyman, Abby Rubenstein
