AUTO

EVs get cheaper as Ford joins Tesla in slashing prices <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D63cf7352> Pink ford riding a downward slope made of money <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E63cf7352> Illustration: Francis Scialabba, Photo: Ford
It looks like electric vehicle Black Friday has officially kicked off. Ford announced yesterday that itâ€™ll cut prices on its electric Mustang Mach-E models by as much as 8%, putting the price range at about $46,000 to $64,000â€”which means itâ€™ll be selling some of them at a loss.

The move follows the unprecedented and sweeping discounts that rival EV manufacturer Tesla rolled out earlier this month. Both companies hope that making the cars cheaper will convince more customers to buy them.

Why discount now?

Demand for pricey EVs is under threat as high interest rates make financing auto purchases more expensive and recession fears leave people less willing to crack open their piggy banks to snag dream cars. Ford and Tesla may also be considering the government tax credits, worth up to $7,500, for EVs priced under a certain threshold (some Tesla and Mach-E models will now be eligible). And thereâ€™s more competition <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C48e972e2> from automakers like Nissan and Chevrolet producing increasingly cheap EVs.But itâ€™s not just EVs becoming more affordable:

New car prices have been slowing their ascent, and used cars were 9% cheaper last month compared to a year prior, when your 200k-miles-strong 2006 Corolla was a hot commodity amid supply chain issues and parts shortages.

Not everyone is celebrating

Many people who purchased a Tesla shortly before the price cuts are not thrilled about having to make hefty loan payments on what is now a less valuable depreciating asset. Some disgruntled Tesla buyers signed a petition demanding free or discounted software downloads for their vehicles, while others have inquired about refunds, according to the Wall Street Journal.

Big picture: Major automakers, which enjoyed soaring profits last year, are now bracing for a reversal of fortunes and looking at ways to cut costs. But difficulties notwithstanding, many companies are still ramping up EV production and legacy car manufacturers are pushing forward with electrification goals.â€”SK

WORLD

Tour de headlines Protesters demanding justice for Tyre Nichols Scott Olson/Getty Images
Two more officers relieved of duty over the deadly beating of Tyre Nichols. The Memphis Police Department revealed yesterday that in addition to the five officers charged with murder over the fatal beating, Preston Hemphill and another officer whose name was not released were taken off duty <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQnk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4535fbe1> after the incident. Although Hemphillâ€™s lawyer told the Associated Press he was not present during the violence that killed Nichols, the officer was present for the traffic stop that preceded it, and body cam footage appears to show him saying he had tased Nichols and â€œI hope they stomp his ass.â€ In addition, three employees of the Memphis Fire Department were fired yesterday for their involvement. Nicholsâ€™s funeral tomorrow will be held tomorrow.

Appeals court declines to dance the â€œTexas two-step.â€ Thatâ€™s not a new TikTok craze: Itâ€™s a corporate maneuver whereby companies facing major liabilities spin off a new company to take them on, has the new company file for bankruptcy, and walks away unburdenedâ€”and yesterday, a federal appeals court refused to let Johnson & Johnson do it. J&J created a new unit to shoulder ~38,000 lawsuits claiming its talc-based products caused cancer, and the courtâ€™s ruling <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQng_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbbd5b988> dismissed that unitâ€™s bankruptcy case. J&J, which maintains that its products are safe, said it would seek to have the ruling overturned.

Spring will bring flowers and an end to official Covid emergencies. President Biden plans to end both the public health and national emergencies originally declared to address the Covid pandemic <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cebbb3abf> in 2020 (and extended several times since) on May 11. The White House disclosed the plan yesterday while opposing efforts by Republican lawmakers to end the emergency declarations immediately with a bill called the Pandemic Is Over Act. The end of the emergencies will mean that many Americans will have to start paying for Covid tests, treatments, and vaccines. It also signals a shift in how serious the government considers the pandemic to be.

LAW

Are these NFTs â€˜artâ€™ or just a digital Canal Street? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D02f9c330> MetaBirkens <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQno_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E02f9c330> MetaBirkins
Luxury retailer HermÃ¨s and non-fungible token designer Mason Rothschild faced off in court yesterday in the first major test of how trademark law applies to NFTs and other digital designs.

HermÃ¨s claims Rothschild infringed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C38c0d6c6> on its trademark by digitally depicting furry versions of its iconic Birkin bag in his collection of 100 â€œMetaBirkinâ€ NFTs. But Rothschild argues that MetaBirkins are a lawful, artistic interpretation of the brandâ€™s productâ€”similar to Andy Warholâ€™s prints of Campbellâ€™s soup cans.

NFTs have been a moneymaker for luxury brands

Though the crypto downturn has deflated the value of NFTs from when Justin Bieber was bragging about his Bored Ape, HermÃ¨s says that Rothschild swooped its chance <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQkI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8336d846> to capitalize on digital collectibles at the height of the craze, like its peers did:

Dolce & Gabbana sold nine NFTs for about $6 million in September 2021.

Gucci bagged $25,000 on one short-film NFT two months prior.

MetaBirkens debuted at Art Basel in December 2021, and were sold and resold for tens of thousands of dollars. The platform they were originally listed on, OpenSea, pulled the collection at HermÃ¨sâ€™s request, but copies continued to sell elsewhere.

Zoom out: The caseâ€™s outcome could set a precedent in this new area, but no matter who wins, the lawsuit itself could deter digital artists from featuring branded products in their designs.â€”JW

ENTERTAINMENT

The Oscars might take back a nomination <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dc96fccc2> Andrea Riseborough <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ec96fccc2> Roy Rochlin/Getty Images
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will meet today to determine whether to rescind <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30404026.3016195/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xQjg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDQwNDAyNi4zMDE2MTk1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C39c1d860> Andrea Riseboroughâ€™s best actress nomination, and if it does happen, it would be the Academyâ€™s most anti-indie-darling move of all time.

Riseboroughâ€™s nomination for her performance in To Leslie surprised Hollywood when it was announced, as the film had seemingly less heat than some Roku originals. To Leslie made less than $28,000 at the box office in a limited theatrical run. But in the waning days of the nominations voting period, endorsements poured in from stars like Jennifer Aniston, Kate Winslet, and Edward Norton. Cate Blanchett (also a nominee) even mentioned Riseborough in her Critics Choice Award acceptance speech.

Whatâ€™s the issue? Well, there are many rules involved in Oscars voting, and in its campaign to receive votes, To Leslie may have violated a few. Potential issues are: a rule against contacting voters directly and encouraging promotion, and a rule against singling out competing nominees by name.

Zoom out: Most insiders predict that Riseboroughâ€™s nomination will be upheld, but some in the industry are upset that it takes away a place for lauded performances from Black actresses, like Danielle Deadwyler and Viola Davis, to be celebrated. Nominations have only been rescinded nine times in the history of the Oscars, and never for an acting nomination.â€”MK

Good morning. Scratch that, great morning because the Eagles are going to the Super Bowl . After dispatching the 49ers, the Birds will square off against the Chiefs, who beat the Bengals in a thrilling game.

And for the cherry on top: Unlike the Phillies, the Eagles winning a championship has not been found to be correlated with a recession.

Markets: The contrast <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb7363d6c> between news out of the tech industry and its performance in the market could not be starker. Despite these companies issuing a wave of mass layoffs, recession warnings, and grim earnings results, the tech-focused Nasdaq is on pace to record its best January since 1999. Investors are too busy drooling over the prospect of the Fed slowing down its rate hikes.

FINANCE

In just 3 decades, the ETF has taken over Wall Street <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D60f92599> A banner for the newly listed ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF hangs outside the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E60f92599> Spencer Platt/Getty Images
Thirty years ago yesterday, the first exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the US launched. In the decades since, these once-niche investment products have become ubiquitous on Wall Street, disrupting the mutual fund industry and transforming peopleâ€™s relationship with the stock market.

You always remember your first

On Jan. 29, 1993, a dumb-looking spider decoration hanging in the American Stock Exchange heralded the arrival <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbe385e70> of the first US ETFâ€”whatâ€™s now called the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust. It had a measly $6.5 million in assets and no one really paid much attention to it.

Thatâ€™s changed. The first US ETF is now the worldâ€™s biggest, with $375 billion in assets, and the ETF sector in total had amassed $6.5 trillion in assets by the end of 2022. While mutual funds still have 3x the amount of assets that ETFs have, the tide is turning: Investors poured $600 billion into US ETFs on a net basis last year, but pulled out almost $1 trillion from mutual funds.

So, how does an ETF work and why have they become so popular? An ETF is simply a security that tracks the performance of a particular basket of investments, like stocks. The SPDR S&P 500 ETF, for example, tracks the performance of companies in the S&P 500. Many other ETFs also track indexes, allowing people to park their money in funds that follow the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

If that sounds like a mutual fundâ€¦itâ€™s similar. But ETFs have a few advantages <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca0b5a3d0> over its stuffy, older cousin.

ETFs generally have lower fees than mutual funds.

They have built-in tax benefits.

Theyâ€™re accessible to anyone with a brokerage accountâ€”you can buy or sell them like you would a stock.

Zoom out: All these advantages aside, the rise of ETFs has been also fueled by the growing recognition that trying to invest in individual stocks is foolish. Passive index funds, which arenâ€™t designed for frequent trading, have surged to represent almost half <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cbe4b1243> of US fund assets, compared to less than 2% in the early â€™90s.

MINING

Anyone see a tiny radioactive capsule lying around? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D08db26eb> Combing the desert in Spaceballs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E08db26eb> Spaceballs/Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
Authorities are frantically combing the desert in Western Australia to locate a tiny but highly radioactive capsule that was lost <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30394229.108032/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd0U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM5NDIyOS4xMDgwMzI/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6675498c> in the vast, arid expanse.

The capsule seems to have fallen off a truck that was transporting it from a mine in the northern part of Western Australia to a suburb of Perth, the regionâ€™s largest city. And finding it wonâ€™t be simple: The route was 870 miles long and the capsule is smaller thanÂ a penny.

But what it lacks in size, the capsule makes up for in radiation. Containing the radioactive isotope cesium-137, the capsule emits the equivalent of 10 X-rays in an hour. Contact could cause burns, radiation sickness, and skin damage, and prolonged exposure could lead to cancer.

So, whatâ€™s it even used for? Mining companies deploy these capsules as sensors to calculate things like the thickness of pipes. The mining company that managed to lose this capsule, industry giant Rio Tinto, apologized and said it was launching an investigation into the perplexing circumstances of how this tiny object fell off a truck.

ANSWER

1. Things developed by monks.

2. They are all places where US presidents were shot.

3. People who died (or entered a very deep sleep) from poisoning.

4. These words end in names of birds.

BUSINESS

Goldman Sachs CEO joins the ranks of execs taking pay cuts <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5828cc6e> CEO looking at smudged hundred dollar bills <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5828cc6e> Photo Illustration: Dianna â€œMickâ€ McDougall, Sources: Getty Images
Goldman Sachs tightened its belt at the expense of its CEOâ€™s wallet. The investment bank announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce327bb26> yesterday that CEO David Solomon received a 29% pay cut in 2022. But itâ€™s unlikely that heâ€™ll be staging a walkout, as his new compensation still came in at a not-too-shabby $25 million.

Solomonâ€™s shrinking paycheck reflects the financial struggles that have been plaguing the bank under his leadership:

Goldman Sachs has lost $3 billion since 2020 on its troubled foray into commercial banking, and its profits declined last year amid a slowing economy.

The bank let 3,200 employees go this month, its biggest layoffs since the 2008 financial crisis, according to the New York Times.

But Solomon is not the only CEO to see his pay package get smaller. Rival bank Morgan Stanley, as well as Apple and Alphabet, have all recently cut CEO compensation (in most cases alongside layoffs).

Why are executive pay cuts so hot right now?

Slashing executivesâ€™ pay is a cost-cutting measure that doubles as a way to signal that bosses are weathering economic headwinds alongside rank-and-file workers.

A 2021 study from Oxford University showed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C32e0cb70> that companies that prioritize paying employees over managers in difficult times tend to get a better rep with customers. It can also be a way to placate disgruntled shareholders who are not too pleased to sponsor the caviar-filled lifestyles of company leaders as they watch their investments dip into red territory.

Zoom out: CEOs still arenâ€™t exactly hurting. The heads of the biggest US companies made 399 times more than the average worker in 2021, according to the Economic Policy Institute, an almost 20-fold increase in the pay ratio since 1965.â€”SK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C35907efc>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xd3I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Bc2865d05>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C787aae66>Â Â

FDA doesnâ€™t know WTF to do with CBD <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da630a7ec> Bottles of CBD oil <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdlo_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea630a7ec> Leon Neal/Getty Images
The Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday it canâ€™t vouch for the safety of cannabidiol <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdi0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3621215c> (CBD)â€”a nonpsychoactive compound found in marijuana and hemp plantsâ€”and because of that, it canâ€™t regulate it. Instead, itâ€™s calling on lawmakers to help supervise $12 CBD lavender sodas.

Why? The FDA said that CBD doesnâ€™t fit the mold of the dietary supplements and food additives it typically monitors, such as ginseng and caffeine. The agency claims the science is lacking on the safety of long-term CBD use, let alone on any potential perksâ€”like preventing diabetes or aiding sleep.

This game of legal Hacky Sack is a major drag for CBD advocates

Congress legalized hemp four years ago, and most CBD is derived from hemp, not marijuana. As a result, CBD got kicked off the controlled substances list and got lobbed from the Drug Enforcement Administrationâ€™s desk to the FDAâ€™s.

Since then, the FDAâ€™s been less active in regulating CBD than a teen in a â€™90s anti-marijuana ad. Thatâ€™s resulted in a chaotic and confusing <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdl8_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C784f2c52> marketplace, and CBD industry players were hoping the FDA would soon start reining it in.

Looking aheadâ€¦while CBD advocates expressed frustration at getting sent back to square one, some members of Congress are optimistic that they can finally sort the issue out.â€”JW

Oh, to be an Amsterdammerâ€”free from finessing a U-lock onto a frozen street sign. A new $65 million bike parking garage <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb1510da4> opened Wednesday in the largest city in the Netherlands, and it is all underwater.

Going underâ€¦the facility is at Amsterdamâ€™s Centraal Station, which sees roughly 200,000 travelers arrive per dayâ€”about half by bike. To access the new parking facility, you can bike right up to the moving walkways that take you and your wheels into the depths of what used to be just canal water. The structure took four years to build and can hold 7,000 bikes. Its capacity will increase to 11,000 when a second structure opens in February. (Hereâ€™s a pretty sick time lapse <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30384369.3014885/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xdzU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM4NDM2OS4zMDE0ODg1/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C37d934f0> of how they drained all that water and built the garage.)

While it cost a lot to build, the parking is cheaper than most bus fares in the US: Parking is free for the first 24 hours and roughly $1.46 per day after that.

Big picture: This new facility is a logical investment for a country in which bicycles outnumber the residents. Dutch people are the most physically active on the planet primarily because biking is such a huge part of their daily lives, according to a 2021 study from global research firm Ipsos.â€”MM

ECONOMY

Howâ€™s the economy doing? <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D5efcc8d3> Larry David saying <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E5efcc8d3> Curb Your Enthusiasm/HBO via Giphy
Larry Davidâ€™s favorite tagline also happens to be an apt description of the economy right now: Itâ€™s pretty, pretty good.

US gross domestic product (GDP), the broadest measure of economic activity, grew at a 2.9% annualized pace <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C91286dd9> in Q4 2022, which topped expectations. And itâ€™s rock-solid proof that the recession weâ€™ve been warned about for months ainâ€™t here yet.

Not only has the US economy regained <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xczk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C840b50c3> all the lost output from the Covid recession, but itâ€™s also returned to its growth trajectory from before the pandemic. Real GDP per capita, which factors in inflation, has reached its highest level ever.

Is this a sign of a â€œsoft landingâ€? Q4â€™s strong GDP numbers add fuel to the argument that the Fed could actually pull off the tricky â€œsoft landingâ€â€”where it knocks down inflation through interest rate hikes without sending economic growth into reverse. The resilient labor market is cooperating: Despite all the headlines about layoffs, jobless claims fell last week to their lowest point since April 2022.

But donâ€™t write off a recession just yet

Economists combing through the GDP report found a few warning signs that indicate a recession remains a clear and present danger. Here are a few:

Consumers are pulling back. Personal consumption, which represents about 70% of all US output, came in below forecasts, signaling Americans arenâ€™t reaching for their wallets like they had been earlier in the pandemic. Growth in business inventories also suggest a more cautious consumer.

The housing market got pummeled. The sector shrank at a 27% annualized pace last quarter as higher mortgage rates put home-buying and construction on ice.

Companies are slowing down their spending. In Q3, business investment grew 6.2%; in Q4, just 0.7%.

Bottom line: The US economy is in a fluid state right now, being tugged in different directions by large, complex forces. Even the people who study it 50 hours a week only speak in probabilities (e.g., â€œthereâ€™s an X% chance Y will happenâ€). When execs and economists say the outlook is â€œuncertainâ€â€”they mean it.â€”NF

Ex-Memphis police officers charged with murder. Five former officers of the Memphis Police Department were charged <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30373516.3016744/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xc2Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM3MzUxNi4zMDE2NzQ0/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C833e432e> with second-degree murder and other crimes over the killing of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who died three days after a violent traffic stop. Shelby County District Attorney Steve Mulroy said that a video of the traffic stop shows the five ex-police officers, all of whom are Black, severely beating Nichols, and asserted that they were all responsible for his death. That video will be released to the public this evening.

While Peretti and investors are jazzed about incorporating AI into content, BuzzFeed will have to tread carefully: The tech site CNET was recently forced to apologize after people pointed out that its AI-written articles made factual errors and plagiarized humans' work.

Big picture: SmarterChild 2.0â€™s success has educators debating AIâ€™s role in the classroom and how to best assess student learning in the new ChatGPT era. NATION

Mass attacks of violence have a lot in common <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D37e98444> The crime scene in Half Moon Bay, CA <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E37e98444> Tayfun Coskun/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
If it feels like recent US mass attacks have startlingly similar details, itâ€™s because many of them do. A new study <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc5e8cb06> from the Secret Serviceâ€™s National Threat Assessment Center examined 173 public attacks occurring from 2016 to 2020 and found patterns that repeated from Uvalde, TX, to the back-to-back shootings in California this past weekend.

Some commonalities:

Who: Almost all attackers acted alone and were men. Though attackers ranged in age from 14 to 87, the average age skewed younger at 34.

What: Nearly 73% of attacks involved firearms, and most of those were fatal. The remaining attacks that didnâ€™t involve firearms were mostly nonfatal.

Why: Nearly all attackers experienced a significant stressor, such as a loved one dying, in the five years prior to the attack, and 77% of them experienced one within a year. Half of the incidents were motivated by â€œperceived wrongsâ€ in the workplace or at home.

The killing of seven people in Half Moon Bay, California, on Monday was described <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1E_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cfcdcf654> by officials as an act of â€œworkplace violence.â€

Most attackers had similar red flags

The study says that nearly half of attackers had a history of misogyny and/or domestic violenceâ€”and that those behaviors â€œdeserve increased attentionâ€ from law enforcement. Violent online posting and chatting can also signal an individual may commit an attack. The Uvalde, TX, shooter, for example, threatened <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1I_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C49ce0464> women online and shared graphically misogynistic content.

Nearly two-thirds of attackers said or did things so â€œobjectively concerningâ€ that the report says they â€œshould have been met with an immediate response.â€ Many of these were even reported to law enforcement, employers, and others prior to the mass attack.

The reportâ€™s big takeaway? Recognizing shared patterns among past mass attacks early could help prevent future incidents.

Zoom out: Over 39 incidents of mass violence have already occurred in the US this year, and two incidents happened in California just this past week. Legislators are debating what laws they can pass <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cefcd33cf> to slow or stop the momentum.â€”JW

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4fa1624d>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1U_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1d5979bd>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb1Y_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce73c6d7e>Â Â 

WORLD

Tour de headlines M1 Abrams tanks being shipped David Hecker/Getty Images
Ukraine is getting new tanks. Both the US and Germany agreed yesterday to send tanks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca50bfcf3> to Ukraine as it fends off Russiaâ€™s invasionâ€”something Ukraine has said it needs to win the war. The US will send 31 M1 Abrams tanks, while Germany will provide 14 Leopard 2 A6 models. Though Western allies have been arming Ukraine since the war began nearly a year ago, there was hesitation over whether sending tanks would be considered an escalation. And while President Biden stressed this move was â€œnot an offensive threat to Russia,â€ Russia has stated that sending tanks will make the possibility of talks to end the war less likely.

Trump can shop on Facebook Marketplace again. Meta said yesterday former President Trumpâ€™s accounts on Instagram and Facebook will be reinstated <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8c8f7566> after the company suspended his accounts following the Jan. 6 attacks. Meta said Trumpâ€™s risk to public safety has â€œsufficiently recededâ€ since then. Before being banned, Trump was the most followed person on Facebook. Itâ€™s not the only social network to welcome him back: Trumpâ€™s Twitter account was reinstated in November (though he has yet to post there, sticking to his own competitor, Truth Socialâ€¦for now).

State abortion pill bans get challenged in court. Mifepristone manufacturer GenBioPro filed a federal lawsuit <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30360855.3032687/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xb2w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDM2MDg1NS4zMDMyNjg3/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C69cd9f79> yesterday seeking to have West Virginiaâ€™s ban on abortion pills deemed unconstitutional on the grounds that the FDAâ€™s approval of the drug should trump state restrictions. More than half of all US abortions are medication abortions, according to the Guttmacher Institute, and questions concerning the legality of these abortions have proliferated since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. Good morning. Today is National Compliment Day, whichâ€¦isnâ€™t a real holiday, but it is an excuse to say something nice to someone today.

But not all compliments are created equal. While procrastinating writing the newsletter, we discussed the best types of compliments you can get. A few we came up with:

When someone asks for your recipe at the potluck

When a high school friendâ€™s parents remember your name (or pretty close)

â€œI see you've been flossing!â€â€”your dentist

Of course, this is not an exhaustive list. Reply with the compliments that give you an especially potent dopamine high.

â€”Max Knoblauch, Sam Klebanov, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

The day the podcasts died <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Da475ef74> Spotify <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ea475ef74> Hannah Minn
The corporate podcasting boom may be ending, not with a too-long preamble before the guest, but a whimper. Spotify announced <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ce18f8052> yesterday that it will lay off about 600 employees, or 6% of its workforce, in the latest Big Tech recession hedge. The shakeup could signal a pivot in the companyâ€™s podcast strategy.

Like most of the other major tech companies making cuts, Spotify cited overly ambitious pandemic growth as the primary cause, and CEO Daniel Ek took â€œfull accountabilityâ€ for the move. Along with the layoffs, Ek announced a major departure from the audio streamer: Chief Content Officer Dawn Ostroff, who was the driving force behind the companyâ€™s $1+ billion podcasting arms race to sign deals with companies like Gimlet and high-profile talent like Barack and Michelle Obama, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, and Joe Rogan.

Although the layoffs donâ€™t specifically target Spotifyâ€™s podcasting staff, the departure of Ostroff is yet another sign that the company is slowing down its full-steam-ahead approach to the space. Earlier this month, Bloomberg reported the company froze its US budget for new podcasts. The company also didnâ€™t re-up its exclusive deal with BrenÃ© Brown, and back in October it pulled 11 originals from the platform.

Overzealous for pods

The tech industry megadeals of the pandemic may have been prematureâ€”podcasting made up just 7% of total listening on Spotify in Q1 2022, the company said, despite the massive investment in tentpole shows. And the exclusive show model that makes popular shows available only to subscribers of a given streamer hasnâ€™t proven wildly successfulâ€”the Gimlet and Parcast unions announced that making certain shows Spotify exclusives reduced their listenership by, in some instances, as much as 75%.

Zoom out: Sirius XM and Amazon Music have also hit the brakes on pods, reducing signing offers and increasing their share of advertising revenue. On the whole, 2022 just wasnâ€™t the best year to talk into a microphone. According to data compiled by Chartr, the number of new shows created last year dropped 80% from 2020. â€”MK

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C58d79cec>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2B96a2e9c0>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaFg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cd9cbc5b9>Â Â  

TOGETHER WITH RAD DIVERSIFIED

REIT 101: Please take your seat <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRpdGxl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C02490307> RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPWltYWdl/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8b5ce790>
First, a quick lesson.

Real estate investment trusts (REITs) own real estate properties that generate income, equity, or both. There are public and private REITs, which trade on and off the stock market.

And there are public, non-traded REITs. These arenâ€™t traded on the stock market, but are SEC-qualified and regulated to give investors more transparency.

Introducing RAD Diversified <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRleHQx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C67fc6f63> and their flagship RADD REIT:

Stock price has grown 122.22% (as of Oct. 26, 2022) since October 2019

Amassed over $100m in properties and offered 13% in distributions back to investors in 2022

The minimum investment is $1,000 and investors can redeem their shares 2x/year. Find out how the RADD REIT <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQyJmxwPXRleHQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb0f8ea0f> can help build your wealth into a legacy.

Covid shots might get more like flu shots. The FDA released a proposal yesterday to streamline the immunization schedule <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30336596.3021342/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xaC0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMzNjU5Ni4zMDIxMzQy/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc64f64bf> for Covid-19 that would treat the jab similarly to your annual flu vaccine. As with the flu, a group of experts would meet yearly to determine which variants should be targeted, and then a once-a-year shot would be made available to the public. The agency is mulling the shift at a moment when only 15% of Americans who are eligible for the most recent Covid booster shot have gotten one. On Thursday an FDA committee will vote on whether to recommend the plan.

Murdaughâ€™s alleged crime resume

Murdaugh maintains his innocence.

A multimillion-dollar fraud scheme that siphoned money from his family law firm and its clients

Diverting of funds from the estate of his housekeeper who died at his home from a â€œtrip and fall accidentâ€

Insurance fraud related to an alleged attempt to have his cousin murder him so his older son, Buster, could claim a $10 million life insurance payout

NATION

Celebration turns to tragedy in Southern California <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D4778891e> Police work near the scene of a mass shooting in Monterey Park, California, on January 22, 2023 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZTY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E4778891e> Robyn Beck/AFP via Getty Images
Ten people were killed when a gunman opened fire in a ballroom dance studio in Monterey Park, CA, on Saturday night. The attack <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZTc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C363214bf> occurred as thousands celebrated Lunar New Yearâ€™s Eve in this majority Asian American city just east of Los Angeles.

Yesterday, police found <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3bf64ca0> the suspected gunman, 72-year-old Huu Can Tran, dead of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in a white van in Torrance, a city about 30 miles from Monterey Park.

That van fit the description of a vehicle used in another attempted shooting Saturday night in the city of Alhambra, when people at a dance hall disarmed a gun-carrying man before he fled the scene. Officials believe there is a connection between the shooting in Monterey Park and the thwarted incident in Alhambra, but have not yet discovered a motive.

It is the deadliest mass shooting in the US since 21 people were killed at a school in Uvalde, TX, last May, and the 33rd mass shooting so far this year.

â€œThe first suburban Chinatownâ€

Monterey Park was the first city in the continental US to have a majority of residents with Asian ancestry: Of its current 60,000 residents, 65% are of Asian descent, and theyâ€™ve established Monterey Park as a hub of Chinese culture in the San Gabriel Valley. The city is dotted with Asian American restaurants and grocery stores, and Chinese films are frequently screened there, per the AP.

Monterey Park, decked out with red lanterns, had been looking forward to hosting its Lunar New Year fair this weekend after Covid canceled it in the last two years. Historically drawing crowds of more than 100,000 people, its Lunar New Year celebration is one of the largest free street fairs in Southern California. The second day of festivities, which was set for Sunday, was canceled following the attack (though authorities said there was no connection between the two).

Big picture: The Asian American community was approaching this Lunar New Yearâ€™s celebration with both an eagerness to gather IRL again, but also trepidation <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZTg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C4adfd0c9> over the surge in anti-Asian hate crimes during the pandemic. Advocacy group Stop AAPI Hate said in a statement that this attack, â€œon one of the most important days of the year for many Asian Americansâ€¦is sending shockwaves through our community.â€

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZTk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C0b139406>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZUE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5372576d>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZWI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C514a3c25>Â Â

Tour de headlines People attend the 50th annual March for Life rally on the National Mall Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images
Roe v. Wade at 50. Sunday marked the 50th anniversary of the now-scrapped SCOTUS decision that granted the federal right to an abortion. Abortion rights supporters marched <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZWM_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C56ad452d> in cities across the country, drawing attention to the myriad legislative battles over abortion access that are now being fought at the state and local levels. Days before, anti-abortion activists staged the first March for Life in Washington, DC, since Roe v. Wade was overturned by the Supreme Court.

On the Sunday talk shows, both Democrats and Republicans said they were concerned about these and other findings of classified docs that have dripped out in the past few weeks. Biden said he has â€œno regretsâ€ about his handling of the situation, and his team and other Dems have tried to emphasize how Biden has cooperated with authorities in their investigation.

The Chiefs handled the Jaguars, my Eagles demolished the Giants, Cincinnati trounced Buffalo (with Damar Hamlin attending in-person), and the 49ers beat the Cowboys. Itâ€™s James Cameronâ€™s world; weâ€™re just swimming in it.

The directorâ€™s film, Avatar: The Way of Water, topped $2 billion <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZWY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cee3e9352> at the box office this weekend, becoming just the sixth movie in history to reach the milestone. Cameron is responsible for three of those sixâ€”Avatar, Titanic, and Avatar 2 (the others are Avengers: Endgame, Star Wars: The Force Awakens, and Avengers: Infinity War).

It will be just a matter of days until Avatar 2 climbs from No. 6 on the list to No. 4, leaping over Infinity War ($2.04 billion) and The Force Awakens ($2.07 billion) as it heads into its seventh week in theaters.

When that happens, the movie could earn another accolade: being profitable. Before the release of the uber-costly Avatar 2, Cameron said <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30326536.3401248/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZWc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMyNjUzNi4zNDAxMjQ4/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6a6f0efb> it was the â€œworst business case in movie historyâ€ and would need to become the third- or fourth-highest grossing film of all time to break even.

Zoom out: James Cameron is the movie theater equivalent of Shohei Ohtaniâ€”a superstar playing on a sorry team. Cinemas are not in a good place right now: Last week, Regal (whose parent company went bankrupt) said it was closing 39 locations in the US, and AMC has lost all of its meme-stock juice.

Good news for them, though, is that olâ€™ reliable Cameron plans to release three more Avatar installments in the next five years.

TECH

That was a brutal week for tech layoffs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D1529e2f5> An illustration of a tech CEO cutting an employee's computer in half <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDQ_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E1529e2f5> Hannah Minn
Across the United States, tens of thousands of tech workers are waking up to the longest weekend of their professional lives.

Google parent company Alphabet became the latest tech giant to conduct mass layoffs <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDU_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C378dd98e>, beginning to let go of 12,000 employees (~6% of its workforce) yesterday morning. And while layoffs have been hitting tech for months now, this week felt particularly painful: Three of the biggest tech companies in the worldâ€”Alphabet, Microsoft, and Amazonâ€”all announced job cuts that affected 40,000 employees combined.

That brings total layoffs in the tech industry to more than 200,000 <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C3a13fbc9> over the last year, the FT notes.

Thatâ€™s a huge number

But it only underscores Big Techâ€™s breathtaking hiring spree during the pandemic. Believe it or not, most Big Tech workforces are upâ€”way upâ€”since the beginning of Covid. Letâ€™s take a look at the numbers:

Microsoft hired 40,000 people from June 2021 to June 2022. So after the recent layoffs, itâ€™s still up 30,000 employees (or more than one Visa) in 18 months.

Alphabetâ€™s 12,000 layoffs represent ~33% of the 36,751 staff it hired in the single year to September 2022.

Meta hired more than 26,000 employees in 2020 and 2021; it recently cut 11,000 jobs.

So whatâ€™s going on? Big Tech companies feasted during the Covid boom times, believing theyâ€™d never get heartburn later on. Now, facing a deteriorating economic environment, theyâ€™re letting go of some â€œmoonshotâ€ ideas, promoting efficiency <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf4fa9dc9>, and being more surgical about their investments (like in AI).

Finally, thereâ€™s one elephant in the room: Apple. Maybe it got lost while using Apple Maps, but the iPhone maker remains the only Big Tech company that hasnâ€™t yet announced layoffs. One factor, CNBC suggests <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDg_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc134002b>, could be that it hired far more methodically than its peers during the pandemic. Apple increased its headcount by just 6.5% in the year to September 2022â€”about the same growth rate itâ€™s had since 2016.â€”NF

<https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZDk_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C57f47947>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGE_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cf00594a4>Â Â  <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGI_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C079b5c68>Â Â

INTERNATIONAL POLITICS

Why Ukraine keeps asking for tanks <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D0831602d> Ukrainian soldier in a tank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGY_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E0831602d> Diego Herrera Carcedo/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images
Ukraineâ€™s hopes of getting German tanks have tanked (for now). Its allies met in Germany yesterday and agreed to send more weapons aid to the country, but failed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGc_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C8e7aa5e1> to reach an agreement on supplying tanks.

Why are tanks still a big deal in the age of drones?

Drones and surface-to-air missile systems may be more modern, but Ukraine says itâ€™s got to have the good olâ€™ armored beasts to mount a counteroffensive against Russia.

The armored vehicles equipped with heavy guns are the go-to when breaking enemy lines in a ground offensive.

Both sides are preparing for a major forward push in the spring, and state-of-the art tanks would be ideal for the flatlands in the east of the country, where much of the anticipated combat will likely take place.

Ukraine is currently fighting with Soviet- and Russian-made tanks, but they are not the next-gen machines its war effort requires. The UK recently agreed to supply 14 heavy-duty tanks, but Ukraine says it needs 300 of them.

Zoom out: While the tank situation remains uncertain, Ukraineâ€™s allies consented to send it an assortment of weapons including air-defense systems, rockets, and artillery rounds. The US is planning a $2.5 billion arms shipment that for the first time includes the powerful Stryker armored combat vehicles.â€”SK

Space is yet again throwing a once-in-a-lifetime viewing experience at us. A green comet is approaching <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZGw_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C6c05014a> earth for the first time since the Ice Age and may never return, so look up now or forever hold your peace.

What makes it green? The comet, nicknamed ZTF, is similar to other giant hurtling balls of dust and frozen gas, but produces a unique glowing green light. How? The sunâ€™s ultraviolet radiation hits the diatomic carbon in the comet (which is actually just two carbon atoms fused together) andâ€¦we would go more into that, but this isnâ€™t Space Brew.

Scientists first spotted ZTF last March, and now itâ€™s your turn: For northern hemisphere residents, your best bet is to look north this weekend, either late in the evening or early in the morning in a place with little light pollution. The comet will be close to the Draco constellation starting tonight. You have until about early February when ZTF heads to the southern hemisphere.

Besides just looking coolâ€¦Astronomers will study the rare comet over the next month to hopefully get a better glimpse of the phenomenon that may have helped create life on earth, before it leaves our solar system. And luckily, theyâ€™ve got the James Webb Telescope <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30316522.3040131/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xZG0_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMxNjUyMi4zMDQwMTMx/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1fbbbff5> to take some pics.â€”MM

Markets: Remember the stock rally to start 2023? Yeah, us neither. The Dow and S&P fell for the third straight day <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN0w_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5caf6443> over concerns thatâ€”what else?â€”the Fed will keep hiking interest rates. Fed Vice Chair Lael Brainard didnâ€™t calm any nerves by saying that central bankers â€œare determined to stay the courseâ€ until inflation is back at their 2% target.

FILM

Alec Baldwin will be charged in fatal â€˜Rustâ€™ shooting <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dcb3fc1b8> Alec Baldwin <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN00_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ecb3fc1b8> Mega/Getty Images
Prosecutors announced yesterday that actor Alec Baldwin and Rust armorer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed will be charged with involuntary manslaughter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN04_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C5f2b503b> for the on-set shooting that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza in 2021.

The charge, filed in New Mexico, is a fourth-degree felony, which means that Baldwin and Gutierrez-Reed could face up to 18 months behind bars and a $5,000 fine. But prosecutors also tacked on a provision that could result in five years of prison time because a gun was involved.

Baldwinâ€™s attorney responded, â€œThis decision distorts Halyna Hutchinsâ€™ tragic death and represents a terrible miscarriage of justiceâ€¦we will fight these charges, and we will win.â€ Baldwin also sued crew members including Gutierrez-Reed and Rust assistant director David Halls in November, alleging they were negligent in handing him the gun.

How we got here

During a rehearsal for the movie Rust in October 2021, Baldwinâ€™s gunâ€”which was pointed at Hutchinsâ€”fired live ammunition and killed her. Baldwin has repeatedly denied pulling the trigger, saying that he had started to cock the gun and released the hammer. Gun experts have been hesitant to support Baldwinâ€™s claim, arguing that would be essentially impossible.

So, how did this happen? Investigators for the Santa Fe Sheriffâ€™s Department havenâ€™t released information on how live ammunition ended up on a film set, but a separate investigation by the stateâ€™s Occupational Health and Safety Bureau found that firearm procedures on the set were lax. The agency fined Rustâ€™s production company the maximum amount ($137,000) for not following proper safety precautions.

The report also uncovered <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN08_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C33b69e37> emails and texts that producers sent to Gutierrez-Reed urging her to spend less time on her gun-handling and training tasks to make time for her other props duties.

Two firearm misfires five days before the fatal shooting went ignored by Rust management, per the report.

Big picture: The tragedy on the Rust set renewed long-standing safety concerns in the film industry over fatal prop gun mishaps on sets, as well as the minimal training required to become a firearms specialist for film and TV.â€”MM

ECONOMY

Extraordinary times call for extraordinary measures <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1c_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Dfeaba563> Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen testifies before the House Finance Committee in the Rayburn House Office Building November 4, 2015. As the US crashed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1g_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cec8917d1> into the $31.4 trillion debt ceiling yesterday, the Treasury Department began taking what it called â€œextraordinary measuresâ€ to prevent the government from defaulting on its debts and sparking an economic crisis.

What does that actually mean? These measures are a series of deep-cut accounting moves <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xN1k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C24f23c7f> that allow the Treasury to continue making its payments. They include:

Suspending reinvestments into government funds for retired federal employees, such as the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund.

Selling existing investments in those funds to free up more outstanding debt.

And while these measures definitely arenâ€™t ordinaryâ€¦they probably arenâ€™t so â€œextra,â€ either. The Treasury has resorted to them more than 12 times since 1985, including during the last debt-ceiling standoff in 2021.

Still, these steps amount to chugging water after eating a ghost pepperâ€”the pain will return. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said her extraordinary measures will last through early June, giving lawmakers about five months to work out a deal to raise the debt ceiling.

Big picture: The US has never defaulted on its debt, but even the threat of it could be disastrous. The countryâ€™s first credit downgrade in history came during a debt-ceiling showdown in 2011.â€”NF

ANSWER

13112221. This is a pretty diabolical set of integers known as the â€œLook-and-say sequence <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30304507.3472363/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xOGs_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDMwNDUwNy4zNDcyMzYz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C192debf5>.â€ To get the next number in the sequence, you read off the digits of the previous item.

For instance, â€œ1â€ is â€œone oneâ€ so the next item is â€œ11.â€ From that comes â€œtwo ones,â€ so you write down â€œ21â€ and so on. So, to get the next term in the sequence above, it would be â€œone three, one one, two twos, two ones.â€

Good morning. The countdown to economic catastrophe has officially begun . The US will hit its debt ceiling today, though Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said sheâ€™ll implement â€œextraordinary measuresâ€ that will keep the government from defaulting on its debt until probably early June.

Still, June isnâ€™t that far away, and Congress needs to work out a deal pronto to raise the governmentâ€™s borrowing cap and avert almost assured economic turmoil and market chaos.

What were we saying again? Oh yeah, good morning.

â€”Max Knoblauch, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Abby Rubenstein, Neal Freyman

ENTREPRENEURSHIP

The pandemicâ€™s entrepreneurial boom isnâ€™t over yet <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2De36b5957> Mark Cuban on Shark Tank <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2o_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ee36b5957> Shark Tank/ABC Network via Giphy
At the rate Americans are creating new businesses, Shark Tank is going to need to increase its episode count by about 4,000 to keep up with demand. More than 5 million new business applications were filed <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM2s_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C7844788f> in 2022, according to new data from the US Census Bureau.

About 14,000 new business applications were filed in the US every day last yearâ€”although itâ€™s still too soon to know how many of those aspiring Scrub Daddies will actually make it off the ground.

Whether this represents a testament to the countryâ€™s entrepreneurial spirit, an indictment of 9-to-5s, or simply a case of everyone seeing the same TikTok about the tax benefits of forming an LLC, itâ€™s a sign that the pandemic-era startup boom may be here to stay.

And it was quite a boom

Despite the vast number of Steve Jobs biopics that were being created, the US was actually experiencing a 40-year decline in entrepreneurship before the pandemic, per the NYT. But then things changed: The number of new businesses created in 2020 increased by 24% from 2019 to 4.3 million as laid-off workers found their savings accounts boosted by stimulus payments and a bull market. Also helpful: rock-bottom interest rates.

The trend continued in 2021, ballooning to 5.4 million applications.

And now we know that the swell continued into 2022. But some areas saw more growth than others. The Southern US has had a 53% increase in new businesses since 2019, with the most growth coming from Florida and Texas, per Bloomberg analysis. New England, on the other hand, is falling below the national average.

Looking aheadâ€¦weâ€™ll have to wait and see if these businesses thrive and the trend continues in 2023. A looming potential recession, high inflation, and personal savings dropping to near 60-year lows (per the Bureau of Economic Analysis) all signal turbulence ahead for new companies, which already have a roughly 50% failure rate during good economic times.â€”MK

Isnâ€™t it time you check them out <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fVz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjkwOTE1LjMwNjk3NzMmbHA9dGV4dDM/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cc2c5326e>?

Ukraineâ€™s Interior Minister Denys Monastyrskyi, who oversaw police and security forces, was among those who died when a helicopter <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3A_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C307e31ee> crashed into a kindergarten in a Kyiv suburb yesterday. Ukraine said it had not yet determined if the crash, which occurred amidst a dense fog, was caused by an attack or an accident.

Not even the powerhouse of dresses with weird cutouts has been spared by investorsâ€™ newfound skepticism toward exorbitant tech company valuations. Shein, the fast-fashion retailer that bills itself as a tech firm, is looking to raise <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3M_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ca1b574c9> $3 billion more from its existing investors at a $64 billion valuationâ€”a sharp drop from the $100 billion valuation the company had in April, according to the Financial Times.

Fast rise: Shein grew rapidly in the last few years, and was considered a no-brainer investment for backers flush with cash.

Fast fall: Now, after spending years throwing billions at any tech company whose slide deck had the word â€œdisruptorâ€ in it, VCs are getting stingy as interest rates rise and the global economy slows down. So, Shein (along with a lot of other companies) is stuck entering a â€œdown roundâ€â€”i.e., being forced to raise funds at a much lower valuation, the FT reported, though the company told the FT it â€œdenied the accuracyâ€ of some of the report.

But all those tissue-thin tees are still big business. Despite a collage of controversies <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3Q_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C36579901>, Shein brought in $15.7 billion in revenue in 2021, per Reuters, and is said to have only grown last year.â€”MM

TECH

A giant bird statue, blue soundproof booth, pizza ovenâ€¦apparently all of these things no longer spark joy for Twitter CEO Elon Musk.

The social media company kicked off 2023 by listing 631 items from its San Francisco headquarters in a virtual auction <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30290915.3069773/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy8xM3k_bWlkPTdjZDNkN2VmY2IyYjVkMWE2Y2JlMGJmMDkzMWY0YjJmJmNpZD0zMDI5MDkxNS4zMDY5Nzcz/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cabcdc134> that concluded yesterday afternoon. Some fun facts:

A single bird statue sold for $100,000.

Over 20,000 people registered to bid, making this the most popular auction that Heritage Globalâ€”which also ran an Enron auctionâ€”has ever organized.

Twitter is pinching pennies millions

SOCIAL MEDIA

TikTok is dropping out of college <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2D39689528> Longhorn over phone with x over it. <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fZz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2E39689528> Illustration: Dianna â€œMickâ€ McDougall, Source: Alano Design/Getty Images
The University of Texas at Austin, one of the largest public universities in the nation, banned <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Cb8084d01> TikTok from its wi-fi and across its wired networks yesterdayâ€”and not because someone made a call-out video of Bevoâ€™s Shein haul.

The university is complying with Texas Gov. Greg Abbottâ€™s recent decision to forbid state employees from having the app on government-issued devices. And itâ€™s just the latest major US campus to confine its students to Instagram Reels: Public universities in at least five states, including Auburn University in Alabama, the University of Montana, and schools in the University System of Georgia, have banned the app.

The backstory: In the last few months, more than half of US states have barred TikTok from government devices, according to CNN. Government officials all the way up to President Bidenâ€”who last month signed legislation that included a TikTok ban for federal devicesâ€”are on edge about the national security and privacy concerns around the app, which is owned by Chinaâ€™s ByteDance. In the past year, ByteDance has admitted to tracking journalists who cover it, and accessing US TikTok user data from China.

These college bans will mostly be...annoying

When you tell a college student not to do something, theyâ€™re probably going to find a way to do it. Tech-savvy undergrads are skirting the bans by using their own data or personal wi-fi to access one of their favorite social media platforms.

Still, the bans are causing uncertainty, and everyone from communications professors to the people running university mascot accounts are wondering how these restrictions will affect their work. Think of the college improv teams trying to Impractical Jokers people, or the sorority rush chairs who use the app to hype recruitment.

But it goes beyond depleting DGâ€™s follower count: Some critics also argue that banning TikTok on university wi-fi hinders <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9faT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C957bbe04> professorsâ€™ abilities to better understand the app and how it spreads the misinformation politicians are so concerned about.

WORLD

A shrinking China isnâ€™t good for anyone <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Df2db37db> Chart showing China's population <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fbz9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2Ef2db37db> Morning Brew
China recorded <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcD9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C904b0b0d> a population drop in 2022â€”its first in over six decades, government data shared on Tuesday showed. The last time this happened was in 1959â€“1961, when the abysmal Great Leap Forward economic initiative caused widespread famines.

Though it occurred sooner than demographers predicted, the current decline isnâ€™t shockingâ€”China's birthrate has been dropping for years, reaching a record low in modern history in 2022. Observers blame the high cost of parenthood, strict COVID lockdowns, and decades of the restrictive one-child rule. As a result of the countryâ€™s aging population, funerals outnumbered baby showers by about 850,000 last year.

Everyoneâ€“not just Chinaâ€“should be worried

An aging population usually creates a noxious economic cocktail of less working-age people available to fill jobs and more retirees requiring costly care. This can slow economic growth (any gains in the daytime television industry notwithstanding), which for various reasons <https://link.morningbrew.com/click/30279635.3066208/aHR0cHM6Ly9saW5rcy5tb3JuaW5nYnJldy5jb20vYy9fcT9taWQ9N2NkM2Q3ZWZjYjJiNWQxYTZjYmUwYmYwOTMxZjRiMmYmY2lkPTMwMjc5NjM1LjMwNjYyMDg/62b63bd3ff8136015c0bece2C1f0970ad> in China was already at a multi-decade low of just 3% last year.

If things go south for the worldâ€™s second-largest economy, the rest of the world would feel it, too. Fewer workers in the exporting powerhouse of China could mean more expensive products for consumers globally, as well as reduced demand for goods and services that the country sources from abroad.

Zoom out: Some experts are staying optimistic about Chinaâ€™s future, pointing to its ongoing embrace of less labor-intensive industries like semiconductors and finance, while manufacturing shifts to countries with more abundant workers.â€”SK

For the gram

Weâ€™re handing over the mic to our copyeditor, Holly, whoâ€™s going to give you all a grammar quiz. Can you spot the stylistic/grammatical errors in the following Brew sentences?

(No literary sensibilities were harmed in the making of this puzzle. We caught each error before the fish emoji hit Slack.)

A survey from Resume Builder found that 90% of companies will require a return to the office this year, signaling a shift away from the softly-enforced hybrid policies that became popular during the pandemic.

The worldâ€™s richest person and CEO of luxury goods conglomerate LVMH named his daughter Delphine Arnault CEO of the fashion house Dior, setting up a sibling battle for succession of his company.

With a narrow majority in the House, these early days are key for the GOP in organizing and setting the stage for their agenda leading up to the 2024 general election.

NATO crisis diffused. NATO member Poland said that the missile strike that killed two people there on Tuesday was likely launched unintentionally by Ukraine as it tried to defend itself from Russian shelling.

ANSWER

A writing tip you can keep in your pocket (if itâ€™s not already there) is that adverbs ending in -ly should not be hyphenated. Here â€œsoftly-enforcedâ€ should become â€œsoftly enforced.â€

If Bernard Arnault had more than one daughter, this sentence would be correct. But he only has one, so â€œDelphine Arnaultâ€ should be offset by commas.

Here is a classic case of a misplaced modifier, as it sounds like the early days won a narrow majority in the House. The fix we went with: â€œWith a narrow majority in the House, the GOP needs to optimizeâ€¦â€

The problem here is homonyms. We meant â€œdefused,â€ which means to make less tense. â€œDiffusedâ€ means spreading out.
